games.name: Earthcore Prominence
games.body:
A long time ago, before men stepped upon this planet, before gods established their pantheons, before consciousness grazed the Earth, there was you.  

There you were , staring at a vast blue, cold surface, carrying fire. You, responsible for lighting the core of this enormous, very wet rock, were going to bring human life to it. You held the fire at the end of your staff, ready to ignite the center most part of Earth, ready to fuel movement in very ground you stood on.  

And not unlike Prometheus would one day defy great dangers to bring fire to men, you were about to dive deep into this tunnel and face the many dangers roaming, swimming around hungry for a snack...  

/!\ WebGL doesn't support Unity's particle systems. To get the true VFX experience, download the windows version!  

Controls:  
- WASD or Arrow keys to move  
- Left click to cast spell  
- E to change spell  

![osszhT.png](///raw/92e/71/z/6a98c.png)

games.name: Diving for Oxygen
games.body:
A short colony simulator where you try to lead your little divers to productive ends, like producing energy and oxygen, so that they can keep breathing.

There is no clear objective to the game, but you'll probably figure out the bounds of the sandbox after playing a little bit. For further details, spoilers: the main objective of the game is to keep the divers alive. For that, they need oxygen, which is produced by divers with the "Oxygen mechanic" job. To make oxygen, they need energy, which is produced by divers with the "Energy producer" job. There is a third job, "Hauler", which can help the other two jobs be more efficient by allowing them to keep working while the hauler moves around the relevant resources. The 3 lines of information on the divers' cards are: Job, Morale, and Oxygen. The job can be changed in the Command Divers menu. If morale falls too low, the diver will go for a walk instead of working to recover some. If oxygen falls too low, the diver will try to find oxygen to refill it. The fun of the game is really just watching the simulation go, didn't manage to add in too much interactivity.

Keyboard and gamepad controls are supported, and the overlay at the bottom explains what the buttons do, but not the mouse (as you might expect from a colony sim).

The game is also on [itch.io](https://nc.itch.io/oxygen).

Jam details: I was originally going for the compo, but needed a bit more time. So the music and art was made by me during the jam. Music with Make Noise's Strega synthesizer (cut and filtered a little with Bitwig Studio), and art with Krita.

![screenshot-01.png](///raw/6e/z/6b07a.png)

games.name: Nightmare Descent
games.body:
![Sprite-0002.png](///raw/9bf/33/z/6b18a.png)

Nightmare Descent is an eldritch horror card game where the only way out is to wake up. Trapped in a surreal dream beneath reality, players must descend through shifting layers of madness. Every level takes you deeper into an unknowable abyss, where unspeakable horrors await.

Choose your path‚Äîface terrifying entities head-on with dwindling resources, or flee deeper into the unknown, hoping to survive just long enough to wake up. If you‚Äôre lucky‚Äîor cursed‚Äîyou may awaken and escape. But every decision chips away at your sanity.

Will you wake up,

Or will the Nightmare claim you?

Bugs:
-Cards using variable values do not work correctly
-After winning or losing, the game does not reset correctly

Credits:
DrSmey - Programming, Art, Design
Noctiluca - Art, Design
pentragon - Art, Design
Tyrrer - Audio, Music!

long ago, Orpheus ventured into hades to rescue his wife, Eurydice. Our story begins a few years earlier. Orpheus has fallen into a well and finds his soul trapped in the depths of Hades! Only Eurydice, armed with her trusty bucket, can save him.

games.name: The fate of Carl
games.body:
Karl fell... but not in vain. In this world, where underground mines hold dangers as much as treasures, the dwarf Karl was a legend. He dedicated his life to serving the Company.
He died doing what he loved - digging. Now his story is not just a memory, but an inspiration for new generations of miners. Karl is gone, but his spirit remains in every blow of the pickaxe, in every drop of sweat that runs down the face of another recruit. Glory to Rock and Stone.

The project was worked on:

games.name: Into The Abyss
games.body:
![Into_The_Abyss_169.png](///raw/72e/a5/z/6af9d.png)

Made under _72 hours_ by @constance, @hikiyoshi and @kamizenki a.k.a _Hiyuka Studios_.

## DESCRIPTION

You‚Äôre an __archaeologist__. Alone, at the edge of a giant hole in the earth. Armed with nothing but your __trusty pickaxe__, you begin your descent into the unknown.Into the Abyss is a __digging-focused__ platformer where exploration goes straight down. Your mission: __reach the bottom__, __uncover the truth__ behind the abyss, and do it as fast as you can, after all you can get a worth treasure. But be careful, watch out for those treacherous __traps__ set by who know anyway.

## CORE GAMEPLAY

___Dig Your Own Path___:Break through dirt, stone, and ancient ruins with your pickaxe. You decide where to go‚Äîno set paths, no shortcuts.

___Find Hidden Treasures___:Scattered along the descent are lost treasure chests filled with rare materials, secrets, and boosts. Getting them isn't easy‚Äîbut it‚Äôs worth it.


## CONTROLS

- A, D: Move around
- Space: Jump
- S, Left Mouse Button: Dig at cursor position
- E: Interact
- Escape: Return to Menu


## TOOLS

- Unity 6
- Visual Studio Code
- Aseprite
- Photoshop
- Audacity

## KNOWN ISSUES

Feel free to let us know if there are still any bugs or issues leftover that we missed in the development process.

## CHANGELOG AND BUG FIXES

Nothing in here yet, be it'll be, properly.

## INGAME CAPTURES

WIP...


## CONTRIBUTIONS

- @constance - Lead Programmer, Level Layout Designer, UI Designer.
- @kamizenki - Lead Artist, Game Designer, Audio Designer.
- @hikiyoshi - Mechanics Designer, Particle Effect Designer.

games.name: Cursor Descend
games.body:
Are you a master of the mouse? Then you've come to the right place.

![screenshot2.jpg](///raw/18c/36/z/6a3a2.jpg)

In Cursor Descend, you will guide a tiny needle-like cursor on a journey ‚Äî starting from the mouth, descending deep through the body, and finally escaping through a mysterious exit. Precision is everything, and your only tool is the cursor.

This game was made for the Ludum Dare Jam #57. And this is my very first jam game!

I hope playing it is just as fun as it was to create:)

# **Gameplay and controls:**

Hold left mouse button to move. Hold spacebar to speed up. Scroll the mouse wheel to rotate your direction.

The camera scrolls downward automatically‚Äîyou'll need to keep your cursor on the path.

At the end of your run, your final score is calculated based on:

The total distance traveled

How long you held the left mouse button during your final streak

And your ‚Äúscroll wheel heat‚Äù

# **Credits:**

"The Way Out" Kevin MacLeod ([incompetech.com](http://incompetech.com/)) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 4.0 License¬†http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/

Kenny Impact Sounds¬†Licensed under Creative Commons CC0

Godot 4.4.1

*This game is¬†Made by FoxEcho¬†for Ludum Dare¬†#57*

games.name: DeepJamGameCan'tThinkOfAName
games.body:
CONTROLS:

ARROW KEYS: MOVE

Z: JUMP/CONFIRM

X: ATTACK/CANCEL

C: CROUCH/SLIDE (WHILE RUNNING)

A: PREVIOUS WEAPON

S: NEXT WEAPON

well, it's not much, and it doesn't really fit the theme, but this is my first time doing a game jam ever, and besides reusing some old sound effects I made and paraphrasing some of my old code from other projects, everything I made (so basically just the code and music...) was from scratch, so I'm proud enough of that.

you can kind of "bullet jump" by starting a slide and then immediately jumping, I even made that boost your momentum a little bit. as you can imagine I spent most of my "development time" just playing around with that. if I end up expanding on this that's something I'd like to focus on really building the game around. you also jump much higher if you're crouching/crouch-walking when you jump.

i wanted to add basic enemy behavior and player death, but vertigo had other plans for me this weekend. honestly, I want to add a lot more to this, I might just keep working on it. but as far as I got done during the jam, this is it. hopefully next time I can make something a bit more concrete and "actually a game"-ish but I'm not unhappy with this.

sprites come from:
2D Pixel Art Character Template Asset Pack by ZeggyGames (itch.io)
Blocks by etqws3 (OpenGameArt)
Metroid like by Chipmunk (OpenGameArt)
Space War Man by Emcee Flesher (OpenGameArt)

music by me, sound effects by me, code by me

games.name: Depth of field
games.body:
# Depth of Field

World Peace? Power? Happiness? Riches?

Puzzle your way towards the one single **goal in your life that really matters**.

In Depth of Field, Bob the Alien is stranded in the strange landscape of an unknown alien planet. Hostile Flora, razor-sharp crystals, and his own sanity are in the way of finding his way through this maze.
Luckily, Bob has a few tricks up his sleeve. Next to his impressive jumping ability, he is also fantastic at squinting his eyes to focus different layers of the environment, which comes in handy when faced with troubles you can't simply jump over.

## Controls

- Move with LEFT and RIGHT arrow keys
- Jump with SPACE
- Switch layers with UP and DOWN arrow keys
- Mute sound with M
- Change sound volume with V

games.name: Fear of Sea
games.body:
![banner.png](///raw/bdc/2/z/6aa45.png)

# Descend into the Abyss - And Your Own Mind!
In Fear of Sea, you‚Äôre trapped in a steel coffin, going hundreds of meters below the surface. Your only goal: find hidden treasures lost to the ocean‚Äôs darkness, but down there, the pressure isn‚Äôt just physical‚Äîit‚Äôs psychological.

**Every dive is a high-stakes puzzle. You must carefully plan your route, dodge deadly sharks, and keep an eye on your oxygen level.** The deeper you go, the less margin for error. Hit the rocky seafloor, and your vessel might not recover. Stay down too long, and you'll never resurface.

This is a game about dread, strategy, and survival. There's no combat. No help. Just you, your submarine, and the crushing weight of the sea.

# Screenshots:
![pack-screenshot.png](///raw/bdc/2/z/6aab2.png)



# Key Features:
- üåä First-Person Submarine Cockpit: Feel every creak and groan of your vessel as the depths close in.
- ü¶à Tension-Fueled Shark Encounters: Outmaneuver aggressive predators lurking in the dark.
- üß≠ Strategic Route Planning: Choose your path wisely‚Äîone wrong turn could be your last.
- ü´Å Oxygen Management: Every second counts. Balance risk and reward as you search for treasure.
- üéß Psychological Atmosphere: Audio design and environmental storytelling push your fear to the edge.

Can you brave the deep long enough to make it back alive?

**Welcome to Fear of Sea.**
No one can hear you drown.

games.name: Potato Planet Driller
games.body:
![BannerLD57.jpg](///raw/f42/21/z/6a87d.jpg)

![potatoplanetdriller1.png](///raw/f42/21/z/6a876.png)

![potatoplanetdriller2.png](///raw/f42/21/z/6a877.png)

![potatoplanetdriller3.png](///raw/f42/21/z/6a879.png)

![potatoplanetdriller4.png](///raw/f42/21/z/6a87a.png)

### LORE

Nobody knows what happen to our planet but you and your crew aren't one to ask question. You saw an opportunity for good Potato Cash and you didn't hesitate ! You bought a drill, repurposed it and now adventure and money await.

Dive into a mouthwatering world where the earth itself is made of ingredients! In this fast-paced local co-op adventure, pilot a powerful food-mining drill deep underground to unearth culinary treasures. Burrow through layers of potato plains, meat meadows, and vegetable veins while your creation is cooking in the oven. Work together inside your cramped culinary contraption to craft delicious recipes but don't let your masterpiece to long on the fire or you might ruin it 

### HOW TO PLAY

You can play alone or up to 4 locally in a vessel that moves through fields of ingredients and hazardous zones. Your goal is to collect ingredients running through it and assemble them to make recipes.
Then you can sell them with the computer. You can cook ingredients to make them better and make a better dish but if you let them too long to cook they will burn.
Some ingredients cannot be combined resulting in a horrible dish.

### CONTROLS

**SPACE** to play

**ARROW KEYS** to move around

**E** to interact

Controllers can join the game as well by pressing the action action button
- When starting the game, either press space or controller action button to pop a player
- You can control the ship to go left and right with the arrows button on top of the ship


Credits for music [HATMIX](https://opengameart.org/content/canary)

games.name: Steve the Smith
games.body:
# Intro‚Äã
Steve must go down into the depths of the mine to collect ores to smelt and sell. Using your pickaxe traverse the mine and collect ore. You have a magic spell to return to the surface, but it cannot bring back any of the ore you mine. To do this, you will need to charge up a ore portal spell. This will receive a charge for every 10 levels you go down.

Don't run out of durability on your pickaxe, or you will be automatically returned to the surface, and lose any ore you didn't send back.

## Progression
‚ÄãProgress is saved whenever you visit the shop or the mine.

## Controls
Movement - WASD
Jump - Space
Mine
 - Up - E
 - Left/Right - F ‚Äãdepends on which way you're facing
 - D‚Äãown - C

## Shop
In your blacksmith shop, you can smelt and sell ores. Click Smelt and select the ore you'd like to turn into a bar. Rare ore require 2, while common require 5, to smelt.

Once done, click on the cave entrance button, to head into the mine

## ‚Äã‚ÄãMine
‚ÄãIn the mine navigate around and break the rocks. You have a limited durability, so keep an eye on it. After you've went down at least 10 levels, the ore portal spell charge will increase. Click the button to send ores you've collected back to the shop. If you want to head back to the shop early click the door button

games.name: More in depth
games.body:
A game where you have to go more in depth to solve puzzles and complete the levels*.


The game is made with Godot Engine. My first time using it, and I am surprisingly pleased. I will use it more from now on.

As usual, the jam didn't go as expected. Initially I had different ideas, I wanted to make an adventure game using some mechanics derived from different meanings of depth, but ended up with something quite different (though the main mechanic is more or less the same).

Overall I'm satisfied as this time I submitted a "full" game, with menus, audio and a whole level. Good enough for the first Ludum Dare. Let's see if I can make it better the next time.

--------------------
*I say it in plural but there is only one level. I didn't have time to integrate everything and packed only what was working so I could submit it in time.

games.name: Mutant Ocean
games.body:
# Welcome to the Mutant Ocean research programme,
you have been selected as an Operator for the Automated Diver unit.
50,000 years ago humanity seeded the oceans of Almenic IV to research mutations in non earth oceanic environments. Now it is time to take samples of the mutated life forms and retrieve the three Autonomous  P.E.A.R.L monitors which contain a mineral and nutient dense physical record of the oceans.

## To control the Automated Diver:
Use WASD Arrow Keys or the Left Analog Stick to move
Press Space or the Right Action Button to swing the sample net
Press Shift or the Bottom Action Button to Dash

## Objectives:
Your role as an operator will be terminated should you fail to reach the profit target for a dive. Your role will be apsred should you succeed in collecting the P.E.A.R.L monitor for the area.

Collect samples of fish, rarer fish will spawn lower, scans indicate abnormal biologies with the deepest dwelling fish absorbing environmental metals and integrating them into their biology.

You have a limited number of sample jars but may purchase some more in the Overview Screen.

Collect samples of seaweed and coral, these are less valuable but do not  have limited storage

By collecting the pearl for an area you will be able to progress to the next dive site, each dive is deeper and spawns rarer and more dangerous fish.

# Credits
Made for Ludum Dare 57 with the theme of "Depths" in 72 hours.

Game designed and programmed by [Hyphinett](https://hyphin.net)
Background Music by Hyphinett

Art by [Tetraminose](https://bsky.app/profile/tetraminose.bsky.social)

SFX & Additional Music by [Kaitlyn "IDKAY" Cooper](https://bsky.app/profile/idkayuk.bsky.social)

Font: [Salty](https://somepx.itch.io/pixel-font-salty) by [Somepx](https://bsky.app/profile/somepx.com)

### Welcome to...
![Screenshot 2025-04-07 181505.png](///raw/3b6/22/z/6a8d5.png)

games.name: Inner Stratum
games.body:
![ITCH_Gamepage_Banner_V3.png](///raw/19c/36/z/6a874.png)
Join your Favorite Drilling Enterprise on a harrowing Journey through the Inner Stratum! Excavate away and be the first one to reach Level 100! Dig up resources, repair malfunctioning Equipment and bear witness to totally normal anomalies. While you manage drills and chutes on your monitors you must juggle repairs and lower yourself into the depths to reach the company‚Äôs final goal: The mysterious Level 100.

![itchmore.png](///raw/19c/36/z/6a8d3.png)

WARNING: Dear Employee, sadly we could not get the game working completely in time! But there is a little bit to explore and play around and we hope you will take a look and leave some feedback, as we plan to continue the development! We have no working Tutorial, but you might understand what the game is about if you read through this page!

![explain.png](///raw/19c/36/z/6a860.png)

Your Job:
Drill down to Level 100
Use Elevator to reach Level 100

Your Method:
Use your workstation to:
-	Get live data on your drills
-	Manage their speed
-	Monitor your progress
-	Look out for interesting Opportunities
Use the maintenance Area to:
-	Repair broken drills
-	Swap out drills and other Modules
Use the Elevator to:
-	Lower yourself into earth‚Äôs bosom
-	Search for Resources to speed up your journey
-	See fabulous sights to behold

Our Gratitude:
-	Bottomless

See the Handbook for more Information!

![Image_Sequence_008_0000.png](///raw/19c/36/z/6a870.png)
What will you find on your way?
![Image_Sequence_012_0000.png](///raw/19c/36/z/6a871.png)

Welcome dear employee! If you have made it this far, congratulations are in order.
Congratulations!
The highest honor is bestowed upon you. The pioneering spirit of Humankind has endured, and the company‚Äôs utmost trust lies in you now!
‚ÄúGo forth, work fruitful and multiply.‚Äù ‚Äì Founders Message of the Day
Sincerely, 
Management

FAQ.
How did I get here?
-	You didn‚Äôt, we dit! Because we can!
What am I doing here?
-	You will be the first to reach Level 100!
What will I find?
-	Greatness awaits.
Is there a Hallpass?
-	Sadly, no hallpass commodities are available at this time. Sorry ‚òπ
How to I operate this Machinery?
-	We are glad you asked ‚Äì lets find out on the next pages! We are in this together, how exciting.

![Image_Sequence_003_0000.png](///raw/19c/36/z/6a8a9.png)
‚ÄÉ
Chapter I: The getting started 101 ABC
A ‚Äì stands for Alignment, align your seat with your Workstation and yourself with its merry Contents
B ‚Äì stands for‚Ä¶ we are, of course, just kidding. 

You are situated in what we call a ‚ÄúRoom‚Äù this ‚ÄúRoom‚Äù contains various commodities for you to use to fulfill your manmade duties!
You are tasked to drill a singular hole to the depth of 100 Levels. Afterwards you will hop into the elevator and lower yourself towards the embrace of the depths. All to raise your self-esteem and our coffers!
To do this you get to utilize multiple chutes ‚Äì your just need to drill one of them deep enough!
A selection of things to look forward to:

The drills will get damaged, and you will have to repair them!
The chutes will contain resources that you get to extract!
You will be the first to find out what effect this tremendous depth has on the human body!

![Image_Sequence_009_0000.png](///raw/19c/36/z/6a8af.png)

Chapter II: The Workstation and YOU
Aboard your Station is a variety of tools at your disposal. So, get started, Captain!
To set the sails of progress into the Sunset you will find your digital Rudder. The computers display a variety of statistics and allow you to manage the drills, elevator and everything that comes attached to your winch ‚Äì the so-called modules. 
Unwind yourself and watch your progress, this place is all about strategy and management:
See your progress and the Chutes in detail interesting spots such as resources will be displayed here.
Get an overview of your active modules and their Heat and Damage.
Configure drill speeds.
And decide what modules you want to cycle to different chutes and what to repair.

![Image_Sequence_1_005_0000.png](///raw/19c/36/z/6a8b9.png)

Chapter III: Drilling in the Age of Repairs
We care about emissions; we care about green planets and all and we definitely care about you.
Every Level you drill away will slightly damage your Drill, the deeper you get the harder the crust will become, and the more damage drilling will cause.
The faster your drill spins and whirls the rocks away, chipping at the very core of existence, the more heat will build up. The deeper you get; the less heat will dissipate on its own. Heat exceeding the first quarter of your display will damage the drill over time.
But worry not! Repair is on the way. Raise your drills up and move them into the repair bays using your Workstation, stand up and take a look at what‚Äôs wrong. Maybe change a fuse or two.
Remember: Never despair, always repair!

![Image_Sequence_1_006_0000.png](///raw/19c/36/z/6a8bb.png)

Chapter IV: The elevating Chute Experience
You can use your Elevator module and lower yourself into the chutes by stepping inside and pressing the right buttons. What presses Up goes up and what comes up comes down in history!
Open your door and take a look at an empty wall staring back at you at worst, or your next motherlode at best! Get those resources to optimize your workflow.
Scrap will let you repair your drills in an instant!
Coal can be used to send your drills on overdrive, making them nearly twice as fast without causing any additional heat!

![Image_Sequence_1_008_0000.png](///raw/19c/36/z/6a8bd.png)

Chapter V: In Case of Anomalies
You may find objects that can‚Äôt be mined by the drills, those must be raised with your winch in order to unblock the chute. To do this you have to empty the Chute from any modules and lower it without the latter to grab it and bring it up to you!
You may have heard of mysterious happenings, haven‚Äôt you? ‚ÄúAnomalies‚Äù? 
The good news is, there are none! You are completely safe!
The bad news is: someone lied to you. Simple as.

Credits:
Lukas Becker (Game Design),
Luca L√ºck (3D Artist),
Cedric Keutler (3D Artist),
Laura Breuer (2D Artist),
Hakim Weingart (Programmer),
Leon Kirschbaum (Programmer)

Special Thanks:
Jakob Kirchhoff (3D Artist),
S√∂ren Dreesen (Sound Design)

![Image_Sequence_1_007_0000.png](///raw/19c/36/z/6a8be.png)

games.name: Magn√©tico
games.body:
# Magn√©tico
*A game about treasure, magnets, and very pressing debts.*

In **Magn√©tico**, you play as a down-on-his-luck magnet fisherman trying to pay off a hefty debt to the cartel. 
With only 3 days to scavenge $500 from the murky rivers of Mexico, 
you‚Äôll need luck, precision, and a sharp eye for detail.

Toss your magnet into the water in search of ancient Aztec treasures‚Äîbut beware! Not everything that shines is gold. 
Some finds are authentic artifacts, others are cheap souvenirs, or worse‚Äîconvincing fakes. 
You‚Äôll have to carefully inspect each item before deciding to cash it in‚Ä¶

**Can you survive the week, or will the cartel come collecting?**


## [Play in browser!](https://yoavkagan.itch.io/magnetico)


## ‚ö†Ô∏è Note  
- Web build had some issues, for a better fishing experience we recommend playing the **Windows build** ‚Äî sorry!  
- Also‚Ä¶ we had to rush the ending for the deadline, so **there's no quit button** üòÖ  
(Alt+F4 works great though.)


![ScreenShot1.png](///raw/7bf/06/z/6b15b.png)

![ScreenShot2.png](///raw/7bf/06/z/6b156.png)
---

## üéÆ Gameplay  
- Fish for hidden relics with your trusty magnet  
- Inspect items for clues of authenticity  
- Decide what‚Äôs real and what‚Äôs junk  
- Sell treasures to build your fortune‚Ä¶ or fall short  
- You have 3 days. No second chances.

---

## üïπ Controls  
- **Mouse only**  
- **Hold left click** to throw the magnet and fish

---

games.name: Depths of Darvasa 2
games.body:
![Created with GameMaker 4_7_2025 9_44_29 PM.png](///raw/693/2/z/6b113.png)
![Created with GameMaker 4_7_2025 9_46_27 PM.png](///raw/693/2/z/6b114.png)
![Created with GameMaker 4_7_2025 9_46_57 PM.png](///raw/693/2/z/6b116.png)

### A Sequel?? 
Depths of Darvasa 2 is a direct sequel to our game jam game we made back for Ludum Dare 48. 
You don't need to play the first game to understand the events of this game. But if you'd like to know where it started, check it out [here](https://ldjam.com/events/ludum-dare/48/depths-of-darvaza)! 

### How to play
You can use either keyboard or gamepad. It should detect both PS5 and Xbox controllers. I haven't tested it with older controllers but they should work.

Move     - Arrow Keys or DPAD/Left Analog stick.  
Shoot    - Z Key or the X button  
Jump     - Space bar or the A button  
Interact - X Key or the B button   


### Story so far...
Darvasa is home to a corporate mining industry. Recently, there's been an explosion at one of the facilities. It's your job as a member of the Conflict Resolution Outfit Unit to determine the cause of the accident, descend into the depths of Darvasa once again and find the foreman in charge of the operation. If he's still alive... 

### Credits
Skawly for the cover art <3   
Conduit for the voice acting and amazing OST!  
Jeremy and Dalton for hanging out while we worked on the jam.   
Tony for helping me play test the initial build!   
AND YOU, for taking the time to play my game. Thanks!

games.name: The Depths of Science
games.body:
The Depths of Science
After a war between humans and machines, the world has fallen under the control of robots. Only a few humans have survived.
You are the chosen one - the last hope to end the reign of the machines.
It is said that the self-destruction button lies deep within their heavily guarded laboratory.
Now, you have the chance to free humanity.
All you need to do is go deep enough to find what you seek.

In this game your only goal is to get the furthest down. But be careful: The robots wait!

Controls: WASD - move
Mouse - look around and shoot

games.body:
Will update more info here when packaging / last minute bugfixes are complete!

Will also be adding HTML5 and Windows binaries soon!

Update 4/8/25 3:46am CDT:
Added HTML5 Export as well as Windows, along with bugfixed Linux version

 Finished massive bugfix session. The main culprit was the health restoration hearts were being spawned on an incorrect parent node causing, but not limited to:
 - Random crashes
 - Index out of bounds
 - Layers that should stop spinning to keep spinning
 - Gates to next depth layer not opening when triggered
 - Final boss to not spawn
 - Other misc issues and corrections


Since during the Jam we never implemented settings, credits, or how to play, how to play:

Mouse to aim, W to move towards mouse, S to move away from mouse. Left mouse for melee attack, right mouse for ranged. There is a short cooldown on melee and you have limited Mana (which regens over time) for ranged attacks.

When moving down layers, you will sometimes YEET across the screen, this is due to the game deciding that you were in an unwalkable area and relocating you (sometimes violently) to a walkable area.

games.name: Gemsweeper
games.body:
Minesweeper meets deep-rock excavation!

Carefully excavate a crumbling mine in search of gems, energy, and framing materials. Use arrow keys or WASD to move around and excavate. 

The core mechanic here is that each soil type contributes a different, slightly random amount of strength to both its row and column. If the strength of a column or row ever drops too low, the entire mine collapses and it is game over.

Green gems are the scoring currency. Pink bolts give energy, which is constantly decreasing while moving and even more so when excavating. Orange framing materials let  you automatically shore up an area that would otherwise cause a collapse.

Out of Nothing is an incremental sandbox game where you create your own experience from nothing, increasing your score starting with just a simple ball and nothing else. In this world, nothing is king, and only your imagination can fill the void.

# Itch.io:

https://xhuriken.itch.io/out-of-nothing

# Gameplay:

Just you and a cute little red ball...

# Controls:

Click left for magic.

Click right/wheel for drag.

Click wheel for camera.

Space for build.

# Craft:

Shop > 10 reds balls.

Black hole > 3 reds balls + 1 grey/purpul ball.

Bumber > 3 reds balls.

Reds Balls Spawner > 8 reds balls + 2 blues balls.

clicker > 8 reds balls

ocillator > 10 reds balls + 5 blues balls

# History:

It's your story! Like a child with pebbles and sand, create your own universe‚Äîyour own empire! But please, don't eat them, especially...

games.body:
![mainscreen.jpg](///raw/38a/3/z/6a5d5.jpg)

"Commander, today is the day. After years of research, experimentation and construction the submarine is ready. This submarine will take you to the unknowns of the world: the bottom of the ocean. Will you help humanity achieve this milestone?"

In Pressure Depths you must reach the bottom of the ocean. This will not be easy! You will need to fix, correct or calibrate things in order to keep moving. If you make mistakes, or are too slow you will cause hull breaches. Too many breaches will cause the ship to explode, losing the game.

When things need fixing an alert will show. Get there as fast as possible!

Pressure of the Depths is a puzzle game in which you must keep a submarine operational to reach the bottom of the ocean. Can you help mankind to this achievement?

Move around with wasd + space to jump. Interact with E.

You can play the game on itch.io!

All assets are made by ourselves, only the ambient background sound and the alarm are royalty free assets.

We strongly advise to play with sound on!

games.name: MESSIER 104 CBH
games.body:
An arcade style game where you control a **SPACESHIP** flying around a **BLACK HOLE** while trying to survive and collect as much score as possible. 

**Disclaimer**: The HTML embed here is a bit buggy, go to the [itch.io page](https://kuboi.itch.io/messier-104-cbh) for a smoother HTML experience

![screenshot1.png](///raw/632/46/z/6a5a8.png)

## How To Play

![screenshot4.png](///raw/632/46/z/6a5bf.png)

### Controls

![screenshot5.png](///raw/632/46/z/6a9eb.png)

## Mechanics

### The Ship
The ship is the character you are controlling.
* The ship has **HEALTH** - loses some health if it gets hit by an **ASTEROID**
* The ship has **FUEL** - loses fuel when accelerating

### The Black Hole
The black hole keeps pulling you and other object towards it.
* Grows with time - The bigger it is the harder it pulls
* If you get sucked in it's an instant game over
* The black hole has a **max size**
    * There is a little *surprise* awaiting you if the black hole reaches it;)

### Asteroids
Asteroids get pulled by the **BLACK HOLE**, try to avoid them.
* If you get hit you get knocked back and lose a bit of **HEALTH**
* The bigger the asteroid, the bigger the knockback and damage dealt to your **SHIP**

### Orb Pickups
Between the **ASTEROIDS** are also some shiny orbs getting pulled by the **BLACK HOLE**, you can pick those up!
![screenshot2.png](///raw/632/46/z/6a5ae.png)

## Scoring

### Score
You collect score from the **SCORE ORBS**. High score is saved and you can have fun trying to beat it!

*Dev highscore: 52*

### Time
The time you stay alive gets tracked on the screen. This is currently not being saved, so just try to remember your best 

*Dev highscore: 04:34*

## Dev Notes
* Will add an itch.io page soon
* I have plans on increasing the scope of the game in the future, had to cut some ideas because of the time frame

games.name: Little Delver
games.body:
![ItchioBanner.png](///raw/86d/c/z/6abfc.png)
Little Delver is a game about a little battery-powered robot tasked to retrieve precious metals for a mining company!

**GAMEPLAY**

The object of the game is to retrieve as many precious materials before your battery degrades, it's an arcade game with an online leaderboard based on total value acquired!

You can use your hook to move around, boost, but be ware of battery level, if your battery is empty, you lose!

**CONTROLS**

**Mouse** - Aim

**Hold Left Mouse Button** - Hook to a surface

**Hold Right Mouse Button** - Pull yourself to the Hook

**Shift** - Boost

**Alt** - Echo Location

**E**- Pick Up/Drop Objects

**CREDITS**

All made by me, Andrea Di Bartolo,  in 72 hours for Ludum Dare 57

Except for cave ambient sound Produced by Little Robot Sound Factory

Intro voice made with Luvvoice, then modified in Audacity

games.name: DEEP DEEP DIG DIG
games.body:
# DEEP DEEP DIG DIG

![title.png](///raw/72e/7/z/6a71e.png)

## üìó LORE

There is **always** one more persistent than the others.
Pushing you to your limits, desesperate to excavate what that could be stuck for eternity, hiding in dark depths nether to be reach by the humankind. 
You're supposed to be the hunter, so why the prey seems to have all the power?
Yes I'm talking about the unspeakable:
The persistent booger...

But today... **table turns**.

**YOU ARE THE ALMIGHTY BOOGER!**

![1.jpeg](///raw/72e/7/z/6a71f.jpg)

## *Ô∏è‚É£GOALS

Your goals are simple:
- **Evade** the menacing finger
- **Fuel** your way by collecting your green brethen
- **KEEP. GOING. DEEPER.** üöÄ
- Be crowned as the **best booger on the planet** *(online leaderboard)*

![2.jpeg](///raw/72e/7/z/6a720.jpg)

## üïπÔ∏èControls :

**Hold and release** to propulse yourself.  
The longer the further.  
This will consume part of yourself.  
**That's it.**  


***Tips:***
- Collect **green mini boogers** üü¢ to fuel yourself and **raise your combo** multiplicator
- Don't hit hairball (reset your counter)
- Don't get stuck in the hair on the "wall"
- Score is based on distance traveled and combo
- *You might want to hear the music when your combo is high...*
 

## TEAM

We were a team of 3 for this one. 

- Quentin Ferr√© - swiss army knife talent *(lots of art, lots of design, some prog, few sounds)*
- Yannick Montes - code or die 
- Adrien Coppola - just listen to the music, and google his name. Or his youtube.


## CREDITS

Melted Monster by Dm Letter Studio - Dimas Prasetyo https://www.dafont.com/melted-monster.font

games.name: Clumsy Hand
games.body: I would really appreciate it if you rate my game.

games.name: Metro Solitaire
games.body:
"Solitaire: A Journey through the Moscow Metro"

Lay out the cards that depict real architectural masterpieces! You will find not just solitaire, but an exciting journey through the legendary metro stations of Moscow.

Feel the lively pulse of the metropolis:

💙 Relaxing gameplay of the classic "Klondike Solitaire" with meditative music

💙 A collection of 52 stations ‚Äî from the Soviet beginning to modern delights

Ideal for those who love Moscow, appreciate cozy games and just want to relax. Can you win? It's time to find out the answer.

Start the game - let each move become a step through time and beauty! 🚇 🌟

Made for ludum dare 57 after deciding that we will in fact be the one to determine our game's depth.

games.name: In Focus
games.body:
## Introduction
In Focus is a small puzzle game where you are trying to solve levels by moving the player character(s) to a star and adjusting your depth of field to do so.

Designing puzzles is hard so they are very easy and this submission is more of an interesting twist compared to other top down puzzles (or at least I have not come across a similar one).


## Controls
- WASD - Move
- Scroll Wheel - Adjust depth of field (have objects go in and out of focus and therefore interactable/controllable)
- R - Restart level!


![Screenshot2.png](///raw/2e8/42/z/6a881.png)


## Closing Words
Please let me know your thoughts on the idea as I may just be blinded by this being my own creation and thinking that the idea is better than it is in reality. I hope you'll enjoy my little game!

games.name: Oh Look, Squids and Boulders
games.body:
First game and first game jam. I didn't really like the engine that I used, and I only had 2 days to make it, but I made something, and that's good enough for me. 
You're on a boat, there's squids and boulders; don't touch 'em. That's it.

Itch version, 'cause it was made it Godot: https://trudgle.itch.io/oh-look-squids-and-boulders

games.name: ProfundiDUDE - In Search Of Planet Telex
games.body:
Dude, the intergalactic pilot, sets off on an adventure in search of the mysterious Planet Telex ‚Äî a place he first discovered in the lyrics of a Radiohead song. Is the planet real, or merely a creation of the British rock band‚Äôs imagination?

Face off against space pirates, dodge asteroids, and have your entire perception of reality twisted before your eyes as you plunge into the abyssal depths of outer space in ProfundiDUDE.![Captura_de_Tela_83.png](///raw/75f/e5/z/6af56.png)![2.png](///raw/75f/e5/z/6aea8.png)![Captura_de_Tela_78.png](///raw/75f/e5/z/6aeae.png)

games.name: Deep in the Internet
games.body:
![PosterDeepInTheInternet.png](///raw/539/36/z/6a26b.png)
Deep in the Internet is a simple game about avoiding pop-ups

After you try to buy a really anticipated and expensive game without money a conveniently timed pop up that offers the game for free shows itself, you click it in desperation...

This is our first Ludum Dare Gamejam and for three of us the first time developing a game, any kind comments and feedback are appreciated!

games.name: Reclaim You Soul
games.body:
Can you find your soul fragments in the depths of hell?

This game was made for Ludum Dare 57, Depths. Had to rush it a bit and music stops almost immediately in the main scene, but I did get to make a "good" cinematic cutscene for the first time. GPU may run higher on older devices (like mine). Did not have time to make the assets less detailed.

Initial Controls: left arrow, right arrow and A/D.

Full Controls: arrows/wasd to move. Z to flip.

games.name: Sinking Hope
games.body:
During a deep sea expedition, your submarine is suddenly attacked, and your coworker's submarine is swallowed hole. Sea monsters tear into your ship, eating parts off of it, and sinking it. Desperate, and stranded at the bottom of the ocean, you must use a metal detector and an ancient trident to find the missing parts of your submarine, and repair it by any means necessary.


|      Controls       |                |
| ------------------- | -------------- |
| **Interact**            |  E|
| **Tab**       | Metal Detector|
| **L-Mouse**       | Attack|
| **R-Mouse**       | Aim|
| **L-Shift**       | Dash|

games.name: Explorem Ipsum: Catacombs of Time
games.body:
## Explore the mysterious Catacombs by collecting 4 mystical puzzle-solving artifacts!

* The Anchor of Xyzzy, an ancient relic that enables teleportation.
* The Hook Device, ancient technology for short traversal and remote object acquisition.
* The Switch Gizmo, a strange contraption that swaps your place with another object.
* And finally, the Capture Gauntlet, which allows you to put large heavy objects into your pocket.

## Controls
* Move: WASD or Arrow Keys
* Action: [Z / X] or [Space / Shift]

## Level Editor
The level editor was made during the jam! It's not super intuitive to use but it was good enough to make all the content in this game :sweat_smile: 

![133885587800196444.png](///raw/993/1/z/6b38c.png)

games.name: Kataboshti
games.body:
You are a cockroach. Not just any cockroach ‚Äî one that spins, gathers filth, and forces its way through with sheer grime-powered momentum.

In Kataboshti, you explore grotesque organic environments in third-person view. Press the spacebar to spin on the spot, collecting dirt and debris as you go. The more you gather, the bigger your disgusting ball becomes. Once it's ready, dash forward and smash through whatever's in your way.

Across three increasingly weird stages, you‚Äôll face physics-based challenges that require creativity and stubbornness. No lives. No Game Over. Just you, the dirt, and a strange journey ahead.

The more you spin, the weirder it gets.

‚Äî

Team: Djosef Wytemalhos, Eric Dantas & Sabrina Lacerda.!![Captura de Tela 2025-04-07 aÃÄs 21.13.04.png](///raw/036/46/z/6ae95.png)![Captura de Tela 2025-04-07 aÃÄs 21.12.18.png](///raw/036/46/z/6ae9b.png)![Captura de Tela 2025-04-07 aÃÄs 21.15.30.png](///raw/036/46/z/6aea5.png)

games.name: Fixey 2 (VR Only)
games.body:
![chrome_N795MthH7T.png](///raw/f58/z/6a4eb.png)
Fixey 2 is a quirky underwater repair simulator. 
![vlc_x9vXa1fimx.png](///raw/f58/z/6a4ec.png)
In this game, you take on the role of a technician tasked with patching up leaks and keeping a submerged substation running under pressure. 
![vlc_KH08RRPmDy.png](///raw/f58/z/6a4ed.png)
With a series of test chambers that gradually ramp up in complexity, you'll use your skills to plug in power, twist valves, and even operate a remote robot arm, all while a snarky overseer keeps you in check.
![vlc_HUZK8xIGc8.png](///raw/f58/z/6a4ee.png)
Built using OpenXR, it is optimized for any SteamVR headset with smooth locomotion and convenient long-distance grabbing to ease your underwater repairs. 
![vlc_2LgGKLU6Lh.png](///raw/f58/z/6a4ef.png)
Android builds for Quest, Pico, and Vive XR Elite are coming soon, so stay tuned!

Dive in, fix up, and see if you have what it takes to keep everything from going underwater!

Average runtime: ~15 minutes

The art has some rough edges in a few places because I ran out of time!

games.name: Cavers Cantina
games.body:
## Note that the embed doesn't seem to be working properly on this site, but it works fine at kristinamay.itch.io/cavers-cantina

You are the proprietor of Cavers Cantina, a place where adventurers and other cave explorers find the potions and food they need to succeed. Unlock new tools and ingredients to help them! Play it here or at kristinamay.itch.io/cavers-cantina !

Each time an adventurer visits, they will have a specific request that will tell you what kind of food or drink they are looking for.

![Screenshot 2025-04-07 193317.png](///raw/2d1/f1/z/6ab8e.png)

Click and drag items from storage to the food/drink appliance you choose. Every recipe uses two (and only two) ingredients.

Don‚Äôt forget to check out the encyclopedia (‚Äòe‚Äô) to see a list of all the ingredients and recipes you have discovered so far.

Discover all 50 potions to help all 10 (or 11??) unique customers get through the caves alive!

## --Dev notes--

UGH THIS GAME. I was much too ambitious so I ended up with a game that, while fully finished and playable from end to end, was missing a number of features I intended to implement. So, when you're playing, if you think, "gee this would be better if X" I probably meant to do it and ran out of time.

This was a solo dev effort, just not enough time to get everything wrangled for the compo. So, since I was submitting for the jam anyway, I decided to get some cool free sfx in there!


If anyone needs a mac or windows build instead of html5, please lmk and I can get one up.

## --Credits--

All art, code, and game design
made by kristinamay
for Ludum Dare 57

font is ‚ÄòMacondo‚Äô (fonts.google.com)

thanks to my playtester Matt!


Sound effects and background music attributions:

games.name: Unfortunate Mishaps of Subsurface Uranium Mining
games.body:
Unfortunate Mishaps of Subsurface Uranium Mining is a wacky game where you need to steer your drill deeper and deeper while managing critical resources to keep the mission going. Your goal is to collect as much uranium as possible. Do it while managing oxygen and temperature levels, refilling your fuel, repairing the drill and putting down fires.

Controls and gameplay:

- Use **WASD** to move and mouse to look around.
- Pick up or use objects with **LMB** and throw with **RMB**.
- Collect minerals and avoid obstacles using the **Left, Right and Turbo buttons** placed around the central monitor.
- Throw minerals into their respective intakes.
- Put down fires and fix integrity issues with your trusty extinguisher and/or wrench.

Game by CLOWNWORKS

![Screenshot 2025-04-08 020802.png](///raw/7a3/2/z/6abce.png)

**Headphones recommended**

**Hint:** Don't get too much speed when falling, you don't know where the end is.

**Credits:**  
Sbeif - Programming, Sound design  
Amedea - Sound design, Graphics

games.name: Deep City
games.body:
![photo_2025-04-07_21-24-44.jpg](///raw/a6b/46/z/6a855.jpg)
A city survives, deep below the crushing weight of the ocean.

Fragile. Flickering. Alive.

It rests on something vast... and not entirely still.

Structures decay. Ground trembles. Not everything down here is caused by the sea.

To escape collapse, you must build a submarine and journey onward ‚Äî though no one truly knows what lies ahead.

The ocean keeps its secrets.

And some of them were never meant to be found.

Inputs:

Left Click ‚Äì Interact / Build / Select

Hover ‚Äì Inspect elements

games.name: Planet Divers: XTREME Underground
games.body:
![1.jpeg](///raw/fd4/95/z/6b0b0.jpg)

#### *It is the year 2399.* The Inter-Planetary Alliance Sports Council has given the game of Planet Diving its highest-level danger rating: Most XTREME. Only those cooler than the IPASC dare jump in their High-Density Shielded Dive Rigs to defy the laws of both man and physics. Are you ready to put yourself in the cockpit, stare down the gullet of death, and fall into the world of outlaw Planet Diving?

Take control as a Planet Diver. Angle shields to oncoming threats, vent heat building up, and manage power to these systems that will keep you alive as you pass through the core of a gas giant. 

### Do crime, dive deep, get glory... 
# :boom: Planet Divers: XTREME Underground :boom:

games.name: Locked Out
games.body: A really short game. Your locked out of your house (and this is why don't password protect your house if you have a bad memory). Surely you left some clues lying around...

games.name: Fifty Floors of Flavor
games.body:
***Play on Itch.io:*** https://hulya.itch.io/fiftyfloorsofflavor

How To Play?
Pick a side and walk to the store:  
WASD to walk  
Hold Z to zoom


About The Game:
You're on the phone with your partner. They're hungry. You're on your way. But the one question that shakes the foundations of every relationship looms ahead:
"What do you want to eat?"

Welcome to Takeout Trouble, a short and silly 3D game about making the hardest choice of all time ‚Äî dinner.
Pick between two takeout options each round, but choose wisely...

Will you taste victory, or end the night with whatever‚Äôs left in the fridge?

# Description
A Frog Can‚Äôt swim is an action game where you will have to find a path to the final boss by modifying the depth of a lake.
Kill mushrooms on your way to liberate lily pads that will serve you as platforms.
# Controls
The game is only playable by gamepad.

you will have to face projectiles then swing your sword to destroy them

games.name: Into The Abyss
games.body:
Welcome to Into The Abyss!

The objective of Into The Abyss is to get into the depths of the abyss to discovery what lies beneath...
Level up your own submarine by getting deeper and deeper and unlocking upgrades for your submarine.

You start with base rooms for your submarine and you can change and level them up by specializing them in what you prefer.
This are the types of room available:
 Basic
 Ballast
 Machine Gun
 Cannon
 Flak
 Mechanic
 Armor

You start with Basic rooms but unlock more the deeper you descend Into The Abyss.

Customize your submarine and defeat the enemies blocking your path to the depths

Ballast room:
Building this room allows you to explore the darkness of the abyss more freely, this is one of the most important room available in the game.

Machine Gun:
Shoot the enemies with this good fire rate but limited range and damage.

Armor:
Armored section of the hull, greatly increases HP. Optimal to withstand direct damage.


Repair the rooms by using the Mechanic room: it will start repairing the room over time so watch out and don't go too low on HP. Increasing the level of the room allows to speed up the repairing process to get you faster in the action.

Beware not to get all your rooms destroied as it will result in a game over.

games.name: Sound the Innersea
games.body:
![banner_title.png](///raw/de4/94/z/6afbc.png)

# PLAY

https://tukisboolukis.itch.io/depths

Saturn's sixth largest moon, and the most reflective body in the solar system. Its 20 kilometer thick icy shell hides an ocean. This inner-sea is warm, dark, and teeming with life...

   Your expedition is tasked with breaching the moon's crust and exploring the depths below. The seafloor is believed to rest 10,000 meters below the ice. 

   Assume the controls of your remote submersible. Dive for the seafloor. 
Can you sound the Innersea?

![web_sub.png](///raw/de4/94/z/6b00a.png)


# CONTROLS:

Aim sub: RMB

Shoot weapon: LMB

Swap weapon: SCROLLWHEEL (must be unlocked)

Sonar ping: SHIFT

Thrust: SPACEBAR


# Gameplay

You must manage your sub's HULL and ENERGY while below the ice. ENERGY replenishes automatically while idle.

To repair the HULL, hunt alien GASBAGS for their useful fluids-

You'll need DATA for upgrades. SCAN alien remains by pointing your sub's scanner toward them long enough.

Use your SONAR often to avoid dangerous aliens and upgrade your sub back at BASECAMP when you die.

![screenshot2.png](///raw/de4/94/z/6b232.png)


![screenshot1.png](///raw/de4/94/z/6b235.png)

# Credits

### TukisBoolukis: Coding

### TheSmellofOxygen: Art, SFX, Music

 And ykydowk on cgtrader.com: spotlight effects

# Tools

Godot 4.4

Aseprite

Bitdragon

BFXR

games.name: Midnight Amplifier
games.body:
A surreal survival horror game about schizoprenic audiophile man trapped inside a mansion that purges his soul inside labyrinth where he needs to find a way out by the help of the "Audio" to find clue.
Play as the man with the ludum dare 57 theme of "Depths" which were integrated with the game as "Mental Depths". Why? Because it's dark, it's spooky, and every 30 seconds, your mental is deteriorate over time until you the world become so absurd that the maze will make you "Detourned" for good...

Made with Godot 4.4
Actually it's not like 100% finish as I don't have the time (due to my actual professional job as frontend web dev)
It's 3D with "Programmer Art" as they might say.

The audio is from pixabay free for non-commercial use (as I don't have time to compose my own)
The 3D assets is all created from scratch with total of 49 logged working hours for SOLO JAM.

KEY:
- SPRINT: Shift
- INTERACT: E
- MOVES: W/A/S/D
- CAMERA: Mouse

games.name: Maps of The Darkness
games.body:
In Maps of The Darkness, you're goal is to get as deep as possible without dying. You can only go so far before you have to return to the start, but you can use gold you find to buy things to make your adventures easier. Make sure to keep an accurate map of your exploration as it will speed up your travels and make the depths safer to traverse.

![Maps of the Darkness.png](///raw/6d7/b2/z/6adcc.png)
**Controls**

**left clicking** on the map will change the a tile to a "room".


**clicking** again will change it to a "path".

**clicking** a third time will make the space empty again.


**click** outside the map will allow you to attack

**E**  interacts with stuff.

If you aren't in range of an interactable, **E** will use a potion instead.

Try to win the favor of the souls and demons that inhabit this hole full of fire and sinners by serving them the best soup they could find
(It's not like there are many culinary options around here.... because, you know... it's hell!).


Try to keep your hellish customers happy or pay the consequences!
If all goes well, you might even get to cook for the master of hell himself.
And who knows, maybe it'll make eternity easier for you!

games.name: Abyssal Mayhem
games.body:
Descend into darkness. Survive the unknown. Escape the abyss.

In this chaotic 2D action-platformer, you play as a daring explorer plunging into an infinitely generated underground chasm. Battle strange creatures, navigate crumbling platforms, and outrun the ever-encroaching darkness as you dig deeper into the earth. But beware‚Äîthe deeper you go, the darker the world becomes, and the more desperate the fight for survival grows.

Controls:

Keyboard:

    AD to move horizontally
    W to jump
    Space to attack
    Shift to throw fireballs
    E to buy from shops


Controller: (recommended)

    Stick or D-Pad to move
    A/X to jump
    X/Square to attack
    Y/Triangle to throw fireballs
    B/Circle to buy from shops

Created in 72 hours for Ludum Dare 57 (Theme: "Depths"). Will you master the darkness‚Ä¶ or become another lost soul in the depths? (

games.name: Grapple to Glory
games.body:
Have you ever thought to yourself, "Self, you know I like to rage at games and Jump King makes me rage a lot. Well, self, what if Jump King was upside down?" 

No? That's just me? Oh well... anyway, the theme was depths and you're in a magic cave trying to grapple down an unforgiving path that wants to blow you

back to the beginning of the map.

Can you meander from grappling spot to grappling spot while trying not to fall into the wind that somehow exists coming from the bottom of a cave?  Can you find the treasure that this mysterious wind is protecting? 

Probably not. This is a game jam and I barely finished. Don't get your hopes up too high.

Anyway, SPACE is action/grapple, move with A and D, boost while swinging with A and D. If you fall too far, you get sent back, so don't fall.

Good luck!

games.name: From The Depths
games.body:
![Screenshot 2025-04-07 203216.jpg](///raw/070/b3/z/6b270.jpg)

## Fight Your way out of the depths of hell!

**Find the boss, kill him, ascend!**

(inspired by The Binding of Isaac)

**Make it to the 5th level to win!**

(Level is shown in the top right corner. I forgot to label it. what's there is for my debugging but it works)
(The game doesn't have a "win" scenario. it just goes on forever)

**LEVELS SCALE!** 

On each level, there are more rooms, more enemies spawn per room and move faster. Health replenishes each floor. Couldn't make health drops :( sorry. I tried.

Controls:

```
W - forward
A - left
S - down
D - right

LMB (Left Mouse Button/click) - Attack - swing sword
RMB (Right Mouse Button/click) - block - raise shield in front of you

To release the mouse, press Alt + Tab (sorry I didn't make it a button)

```

Woo Hoo! Another Solo Jam under my belt. Haven't done it alone since my first Jam! and it's (technically) a full game!... and by that I mean it has 

**Things I wish I could have done:**

1. Health and item drops
2. Different weapons, including bows and other swords
3. different shields with different sizes or weights or something
4. more enemies and bosses - sorry there's only 1 enemy type of each but at least they scale per level
5. Win state - although I do like the infinite version.
6. tweaked enemies
7. better sounds - yeah... my sounds are pretty basic clips of recordings of myself
8. music - ugh this needs it but I lowered the priority on that to get the game out. a few sound effects were last
9. improved environments - yeah they are flat and boring as hell but I was trying to push this through on my own! QQ I wanted to add rocks and textures and torches and spikes and pits and so much more.
10. controller support
11. better player controls. you can't even jump. wasn't critical so I put it off and ended up not having enough time
12. title screen menu and more options. 

Tools used:
Game Engine: Godot
3D stuff: Blender
2D stuff: Piskel (past: LibreSprite/Asperite, inkscape)
audio: Audacity (for simple sound manipulations) (past: LMMS for music composition)

games.name: Vs. the Deep
games.body:
![Unity_pkrawe48lA-export.gif](///raw/92b/32/z/6afa1.gif)

Fight against monsters as you try to reach the bottom of the sea.

The game is a card game.

games.name: Through the hell
games.body:
Welcome to the battlefield soldier! You have the honour of being a messenger on the front line. Run across neutral territory through trenches and barbed wire. There is chaos and death everywhere, but remember: victory depends on your speed and luck! Will you be able to fulfil an assignment on which the lives of hundreds of soldiers depend! The spirit of patriotism and agility will help...

The distant echoes of battle recede, then as if the whole reality passes through you. Moments you remember that all this has already happened and now the same order sounds again and again, which repeats from time to time that ‚ÄòThe war will never end‚Äô.

You have the burden of living through the horrors of war again, but this time your soul is at stake. Get to the crisis point and find a way out of this endless hell, because you have an eternity to do it...

__________________________________________________

You are an experienced fisherman and your main goal is to catch the mysterious anglerfish, which is famous for its rarity and lives only at the deepest depths. 

Choose your strategies carefully, use different lures and fishing rods to catch anglerfish and prove to everyone that you are the best fisherman in the world! 

The game has a story mode in which you need to catch an anglerfish, and an endless one in which you can compete for the title of the best fisherman with other players.

Turn on your skills, intuition and patience, and let your underwater adventure to the depths begin!

You have to get to the 6th planet. Dig in the ground, get fuel and money, buy upgrades in the ship and win.

games.name: M.I.N.E - Massive Indifferent Neverending Exploitation
games.body:
# About
![MainMenu.png](///raw/38f/83/z/6b275.png)
Explore the deep, unending, underground. You might even find... Spice....

Tought that will take effort and many attempts.

Manage your mining company. Send your workers down into the hell that is the mineshaft.

# How to play

You get a starting inventory of items (tools, transportation options) and a bit of money. Dig shafts, place ladders, earn money, get rich.

### Buying  & Selling
![OverviewShops.png](///raw/38f/83/z/6b253.png)
1. Click the store to buy items
2. Click the respective depository to sell the collected minereals.

### Placing tools
![PlaceDigger.png](///raw/38f/83/z/6b227.png)
1. Select "Mining tool" category
2. Select "Pickage".
3. click on available digging site

### Placing transportation
![PlaceHorizontal.png](///raw/38f/83/z/6b261.png)
1. Select "Horizontal transportation" category
2. Place it on any available site.

**Important:** When placing horizontal transporation items, the direction is VERY important.

### Removing and Upgradde *- with two Ds, for it's double dose of pimp*
![ToolMenu-Arrow.png](///raw/38f/83/z/6b29d.png)
1. Remove the clicked tool or transportation item.
2. Upgrade the item - upgrade must be in inventory beforehand (greed => disabled)

# Know issues
 - We developed on PC - but mobile *should* be supported. iOS less so than android for some reaason.


### Edit
- Improved description

games.body:
Pull off gravity-defying stunts, rack up trick combos, and stick the perfect landing. Just don‚Äôt dive too deep!

Deep Dive is an arcade diving game where style meets precision. Check the water‚Äôs depth above deadly spikes, launch with finesse, spin through the air, and nail your entry. One wrong move, and it‚Äôs game over. How deep will you go for glory?

## Helpful hints
- Playable with keyboard or a controller.
- The scoring system has ...*depth*.

## Showcase
![Jump.gif](///raw/d67/a3/z/6b2ec.gif)

![Trick.gif](///raw/d67/a3/z/6b2e7.gif)

![Entry.gif](///raw/d67/a3/z/6b2ef.gif)

## Extra notes
- There is a sandbox mode if you want to practice tricks without worrying about depth.

games.name: Gleaming Depths
games.body:
# DEEP DIVE: THE OCEAN'S DEPTHS

![Diver Logo](///raw/714/1/z/6b148.gif)

## Description
Plunge into the mysterious abyss as a daring diver on a quest to reach the ocean floor. Your adventure begins near the surface, but the true treasures and challenges await in the deep unknown.

## Game Features
- Descend deeper into the ocean by collecting and extending your diving rope
- Hunt dangerous sea creatures with your trusty harpoon
- Collect coins from defeated creatures to upgrade your equipment
- Engage in dice-based combat system that combines strategy and luck

Every fathom brings new challenges and rewards as you navigate through increasingly hostile waters. Manage your resources wisely, upgrade your gear, and test your luck with the dice to become the master of the deep!

## Screenshots

| ![diver9.gif](///raw/714/1/z/6b1cd.gif) | ![diver8.gif](///raw/714/1/z/6b1cb.gif) |
|:------------------------------------------------:|:------------------------------------------:|
| Kill deep creatures                              | Combine Dices                              |

## How to play
- **MOUSE** - Use mouse for input

![Game Controls](///raw/714/1/z/6b16c.png)

games.name: How the Moon Got Its Colors
games.body:
![logo.png](///raw/7ae/5/z/6b0a2.png)
In ancient times, when humankind was yet young and spirits still roamed the land, the world blossomed with deep and vibrant color.

The moon in its gray pallor looked upon the world's rich hues and coveted them. With each passing night, its jealousy grew and grew, until one night, the moon descended to the earth to weep. Its jealous tears flooded the world, washing all color from the land. Before long, the entire earth was dull.

A brave earth spirit heard the cries of anguish and ventured out toward the sound. As it touched the moon's tears, it realized how to restore the depths of color to the world...

![ShootIcon.png](///raw/7ae/5/z/6b0a4.png)

**All art, music, sound effects, and writing created in 72 hours for Ludum Dare 57: Depths.**

Stay tuned for our post-jam version, which will include composer notes explaining how we interwove **17**(!) different tracks to represent the blooming and deepening of complexity and color as the game progresses. Yes, the jukebox is for those of you who would rather make music by turning knobs than catching tears.

*We hope you enjoy this fable, our love letter to you in these tumultuous times. May we continue to create together.*

![LD25__story_book_flower_yellow.png](///raw/7ae/5/z/6b0a6.png)

games.name: DI(V)E - Beneath the Waves
games.body:
![itch banner.png](///raw/19d/06/z/69980.png)
_______________________________________________________________________

Hey Rookie!
Yeah, sorry for the sudden wake-up, but something weird‚Äôs going on. Again. No, not the coffee machine this time‚Äîwell, also the coffee machine‚Äîbut that‚Äôs not your concern.

We just picked up a signal from our waste disposal vessels. Emergency-type. Origin‚Äôs... below us. Like, deep down. Somewhere it really shouldn‚Äôt be. No idea how it ended up there... let's just hope the retired biomass it was carrying hasn't leaked... who knows what effect that'd have on the environment... and our paychecks.

Anyway. Someone‚Äôs gotta check it out. Guess who‚Äôs next on the roster?

Grab your suit, take a deep breath and find that trash sub ASAP! 
Oh, and whatever you do ‚Äî hold on to that flashlight!

Good luck down there. Try not to die, yeah?


You were hired as part of the
Ludum Dare 57

Theme: Depths

 ______________________________________________________________________

[LOG-ECHO 069.B | Recovered Fragment ‚Äì Origin: Ludum Whiskers]
 
"Personnel Manifest? Or just another pile of names carved into the biomass?"

SYSTEM RECORDS: (Handwriting partially corrupted, assumed translation below)

TheWhiteShadow
‚Äì code engineer, responsible for most of the system logic. Blamed for the flickering lights on Floor 3. Still denies it.

Mervvel / Marvin
‚Äì also coding. Often found arguing with pipes. Pipes never respond.

lensu
‚Äì environmental visual specialist. Designed the walls. Possibly also lives in them now.

idk some itchio guy / Nadine
‚Äì creature concepts. No one has seen her, but her designs keep showing up.

MissSpelled / Anouk
‚Äì responsible for cutscene structuring and narrative fragments and soundeffects. Rumored to speak directly to the vents.

HowToBeHayes
‚Äì designed the diver‚Äôs suit and built the game pages. Left mysterious coffee mugs everywhere.

Milumalu
‚Äì reshaped the outside zones. Plants, rocks, stuff that might be breathing. Good eye for spooky things.

END LOG
(If found, please return to the nearest station. And stop reading other people‚Äôs files.)

games.name: Gaga Diver
games.body:
![ld57_cover.png](///raw/a9a/12/z/6a61f.png)
![gagadiver_trailer.gif](///raw/a9a/12/z/6a6af.gif)
## Introduction
A duck is learning how to grab fishes like a bird.
Let's diving deeper, and flying higher.

## Control
Left/Right Arrows - horizontal movement
Space - boost when diving OR flying. 
E/Up arrow - interact, to buy abilities
Tab - pause game when pressing

## How to win
this is a high score game, try to get higher score before your energy use out.
When your energy use out, you will back to shore automatically, and end current game round, please try again.

## How to play
- dive deeper, fly higher
- use boost to go deeper or higher
- touch fishes will get fish count and score
- when arrive a new depth, some score will be gained.
- different "fishes": snail, small fish, frog, long fish
- bump to obstables will decrease energy

## Credits
- Code/Design Justus
- Art/Concept Jkllin
- SFX chip-tone
- BGM Suno

games.name: Nine Lives Deep
games.body:
# Nine Lives Deep
Since childhood, Matteo and Leonardo have heard tale of a legendary treasure, one which only a cat who came from the moon can find it. 

But only Matteo is a cat, and he came from the piers. Leonardo isn‚Äôt so sure, and thinks Matteo might be destined for more.

Together they will brave the turquoise depths, braving monsters and waves along the way in this top down combat adventure game!


## Controls:
* W/A/S/D -**Move**
* Left shift - **Dash**
* Spacebar (Holding anchor): **Throw anchor. **
* Spacebar (Not holding anchor): **Pull anchor towards yourself**
 
## Combat
![combat.gif](///raw/db1/6/z/6b44c.gif)
You deal damage by hitting enemies with your anchor, there are two ways of doing so:
* Moving around & building momentum (typically spinning it)
* Throwing or Pulling the anchor (using Spacebar). 

Proper description coming soon!

games.name: Squirrel swirl
games.body:
![screenshot.png](///raw/d7d/43/z/6a890.png)


# Gameplay
Welcome to our IDLE / Tower Defense Game: **Squirrel swirl**

Explore the depht of the forest to gather ressources and defend yourself against the evil ducklings.

This game is set up in three phases:

1. Noon phase: Build your path into the woods to collect different ressources. But be mindfull, as the amount of resources increases step by step.

 - Acorn: Used to build new roads

 - Meat: increases the productivity of your horde

 - Crystal: used to upgrade your tower

2. Dusk phase: Short phase to prepare yourself for the upcoming wave.
 - Frost tower: decreases the speed of the enemies
 - Damage tower: increases damgage output
 - Speed tower: increases the tower attack speed

3. Night phase: Fight against a wave of enemies (unskippable)
 - amount of enemies increases every night

## Controls

Interact: left mouse button

move camera: WASD or put your mouse to the edge of the screen
skip to next phase: SPACE

Focus camera on the base: Q

Focus camera on the road: E

Pause: ESC

## Note

You can either play the browser version or as a download. If you have performance issues we recommend playing the download version.

## **Known Bugs**

‚ÄãIn the browser version, keyboard input may not work occasionally. Use the downloadable version instead. 


# Thank you for playing :v:

games.name: FORMIDRILL
games.body:
:arrow_down: Go to the links section to **Play in Browser** :arrow_down: 
  
  
**Explore treacherous depths of the Earth!**

Your anthill has just developped a new machine, the Formidrill! It is the most powerful excavator ever built by ants, and your Queen intends to use it to explore deep down! Come aboard with her and try to survive whatever is waiting for you down there!

A nervous narrative real-time tactical game where you must think fast to allocate your worker ants to the right functions of the drill to fight back against angry worms and prevent overheating!

![ant_cleanworm.png.PNG](///raw/c07/03/z/6b080.png)

# How to play

Formidrill is a nervous narrative real-time tactical game. As you go down into the earth, you must fight against worms and control the drill's internal temperature.
* **Fighting worms**: place ants in the gun rooms and shoot worms with your mouse. Be careful, the left cannon only shoots left, the right cannon only right!
* **Controlling temperature**: the more you go, the faster the temperature will rise! Place ants in the cooler room to bring the temperature down.
* **Keeping your ants alive**: more ants mean more actions. Remove your ants from a room before it is attacked by a worm so it is not eaten alive! If you loose one ant, that may happen, watch out for new eggs laid by the queen, they need your workers' attention to hatch!
* **Some more surprises arrive later in the game**, no spoilers here!

![ant_pump.png.PNG](///raw/c07/03/z/6b08e.png)

‚Äã**Remember: keep cool, be aware, look everywhere for signs of danger!**

# Assets
Everything in this game has been made in the course of Ludum Dare 57, including:
* Gameplay mechanics
* Graphics
* All musics and sounds
* Shaders

Exceptions :
* Fonts
* Our logo splashscreen (Taboul√© Recipe)

# Tools
* Game engine: Unity
* Pixel art: Krita
* Music: FL Studio

![ant_walk.png.PNG](///raw/c07/03/z/6b097.png)

# Changelog
## v1.0
Original game release during the Ludum Dare.

games.name: DeepSigma
games.body:
THIS IS OUR FIRST GAMEJAM!!
(please be kind)


DeepSigma is an adventure video game set in the dark depths of the ocean. One day, a mysterious signal is picked up from the bottom of the sea. You are Walter, an experienced diver, and you decide to set out in your submarine to find out where it is coming from.

But something goes wrong.

The submarine crashes. Everything goes dark.

Now you are stuck on the ocean floor, alone, with no way out. To survive, you'll have to explore, solve puzzles and face strange presences hiding in the dark.

But the ocean won't let you go.

Are you ready to face your fears, there where no one can hear you![ICONA VIDEOGIOCO.png](///raw/f19/36/z/6a27c.png)

games.name: A Well to Wonderland
games.body:
**Known bugs:**
- When finishing a level, you do get back your 5 lives, but the UI won't update
- After a game over, replaying the game will sometimes cause the QTE obstacles not to register inputs. Refreshing the page solves the issue


![IMG_2337.png](///raw/5ce/1/z/6aff4.png)

**Gameplay**

A Well To Wonderland is a fast down-scrolling game.

You are Alice, falling through three stages of the wonderland

A lot of stuff is on your way and you want to clear the path to avoid the crash.

You're late, you're late ! Pick up the pace to make it in time !


![IMG_2340.png](///raw/5ce/1/z/6aff0.png)

**Controls**

Use space key to control speed and avoid the blinkable obstacle

Use arrow key to resolve QTE 


![IMG_2338.png](///raw/5ce/1/z/6aff1.png)

**Team**

**Axodo** - [Itch.io](https://axodo.itch.io/) - [Bluesky](https://bsky.app/profile/axodo.bsky.social)

**Merivia** - [Twitter](https://x.com/merrymerivia)

**Monogatari** - [Itch.io](https://monogatarimusic.itch.io/) - [Bandcamp](https://monogatari2.bandcamp.com/) - [Linktree](https://linktr.ee/MonogatariVGM)

**Tools**

**Dev** : Unity & Git

**Music & Sound** : FL Studio

**Art & Animation** : Procreate

This was a challenging and fun game to make, as always we struggled with time and couldn't put everything in it but still, we're really happy about it =)

Oh Dear! Thanks a lot for playing, and see you on the next jam !)

games.name: Deeper
games.body:
Note: Unfortunately this jam came around a time in which I was quite busy, so I never had time to commit to the grind this go around. I was able to scrap this together in a total of about 8 cumulative hours of work, so I think its better than nothing. Regardless, please try it out!


![Screenshot 2025-04-07 171604.png](///raw/1f4/84/z/6b390.png)


Survive as long as possible by shooting the monsters and sparing your friends



CONTROLS:

wasd - move

Space/Left click - shoot

P - pause



HOW TO PLAY:

Humans look exactly like you but without a headlight.

Monsters may resemble humans, but have imperfections.



Not shooting humans adds them to your party.



Missing shots, shooting humans, and watching humans get taken away will increase the parties nerves.



If you or another human gets too nervous, they will die.


STRENGTH IN NUMBERS
STAY ALIVE

games.name: Depths Space 9
games.body:
![main_menu.png](///raw/8d0/1/z/6a576.png)

Pushing into the depths of space
---
In Depths Space 9 you push forward into the depths of space, on a mission to escape the claws of the cruel rule of the Glorpixian Empire. Your goal is to match the target star constellations so your warp computer can find the correct coordinates to your next jump location. But beware, as long as you are still in their territory the Glorpixians are near and try to locate your ship and hunt you down.

Can you make your escape in time?

Controls
---
- A: roll left
- D: roll right
- Shift: hold for fast roll

Notes
---
You don't need to be 100% exact on the alignment, your navigation system can fix smaller misalignments. 

![ingame.png](///raw/8d0/1/z/6a567.png)

![in_warp.png](///raw/8d0/1/z/6a568.png)

games.name: You Gnome the Drill!
games.body:
People always confuse Gnomes with Dwarves and compare them to each other. You've had enough of that!  
You are a Gnome who is tired of the Dwarves being known as the best hole diggers in all the land.  
For this reason, you built a giant drill to do the work for you... as long as it has enough fuel...

Gather resources as you explore the dungeon, but return in time  
to keep your drill safe from waves of attacking monsters! ![character.gif](///raw/486/f5/z/6a537.gif)
## Controls
**Walking:** A,D  
**Jumping:** Spacebar  
**Dash:** Right Mouseclick  
**Shoot:** Left Mouseclick  
![character.gif](///raw/486/f5/z/6a537.gif)
This Interface shows you the oil tank of your drill. If this hits zero it is game over.  
It drops over time and loses even more when an enemy hit the drill.
![OilTankV2Border.gif|10000](///raw/a48/f5/z/6aaca.gif)
You can refill your oil tank by collecting these crystals within the mine.
![OilCrystal.png](///raw/a48/f5/z/6aadf.png)
You can see how long until the next monster wave with this bar.  
As it gets closer to being full you should head back to your drill to defend it.
![DrillHPmoved.gif](///raw/a48/f5/z/6aacc.gif)
Picking up this crystal can help you get back faster. For each stack of this resource you can dash once using it up.
![DashCrsytal.png](///raw/a48/f5/z/6aade.png)
The last resource you can find is the ammunition for your weapon.  
You will need it to defeat the enemies attacking your drill so make sure to gather enough of it.
![muniCrystal.png](///raw/a48/f5/z/6aadb.png)
The enemies can deal damage to your character too.
![PlayerHPBorder.gif](///raw/a48/f5/z/6aad1.gif)
You can refill your health by picking up health crystals in the mine.
![HealthCrystal.png](///raw/a48/f5/z/6ab8d.png)

## Screenshots
The Drill digs Deeper and Deeper!
![Drill.png](///raw/486/f5/z/6a52b.png)
Go deep into the dungeon and collect resources!
![inLevel.png](///raw/486/f5/z/6a533.png)
But be back in time, to defend your Drill!

## Team
**Benedikt Mertes** / bene-labs **- Coding, Gamedesign**  
**Alexander Bobb** / Dephos **- Leveldesign, Gamedesign**  
**Christopher Graen** / Eos034 **- Art**  
**Nando Berg** / UmbraLux **- Art, Coding**  
**Johannes J. Kross** / P3ngui **- Music, Sounddesign**  

**Special Thanks** to **Jan Ble√ümann, Mike Missiamey und Moritz** for helping us out at the Jam on site!

![Drill.gif](///raw/486/f5/z/6a52a.gif)

games.name: Depth Dive
games.body:
![title screen 640x512.png](///raw/152/f/z/6a7bb.png)
# Jump in, fall deep, die often!

Welcome to a different kind of high dive!



You dare to jump into the water! The pool? Deeper than you thought ... What begins as a harmless jump turns into an unexpected journey - an endless fall, deep, deep down into the world. You break through layer after layer. Wait! Is this the Hollow Earth?!

Fall through absurd sectors, dodge obstacles and don't lose your head (or all your hearts).

How far can you fall before you're crushed? Will you survive?



## Gameplay

Survive all levels all the way to the bottom! Every hit costs you a heart. If you lose all your hearts, you restart at the beginning of the current sector.

How many lives do you need to reach the bottom?

![2025-04-07 23_40_35-NVIDIA GeForce Overlay DT.png](///raw/152/f/z/6a7e0.png)

## Controls üéÆ
- Arrow keys or WASD to move.
- ESC to pause the game, look at the controls or get back to the main menu.

## Team

Eddie ‚Äì Programming

Danya & Silvi ‚Äì Graphics

Patrick ‚Äì Sounds & Music

Jens ‚Äì Level Design

Basti ‚Äì Dialogue & Support ‚ù§Ô∏è

Rina ‚Äì Testing & Feedback

games.name: Potions on Paws
games.body:
Help Hexie with her potions by collecting fresh ingredients and brewing them up to truly experience the full depths of flavour.
Each potion can have a range of flavours, effects and all of this information is stored in Hexie's Nekonomicon! 

With each customer quest you fulfil in the store, they can offer you more ingredients and friendship to aid you on your potion making adventure. Did you make a potion that you don't need? No problem! Place it in the store front and wait for the perfect customer to buy it!

Your shop's basement is home to a collection of mini-games which offer different ingredients based on the level. With 25 different ingredients, what sort of potions will YOU make?

![Untitled 1.png](///raw/f77/c2/z/6b0c4.png)

**Controls:**
- `[W]` / `[A]` / `[S]` / `[D]` to walk
- hold `[shift]` to sprint
- `[E]` to interact with customers, advance dialogue and to place potions on shelves
- `[Tab]` to read your Nekonomicon
- `[Q]` to view your current quest
- `[F]` to view your _tasty_ ingredients in your inventory
- `[R]` to view your discovered potion recipes
- `[T]` to view your _awesome_ brewed potions in your inventory
- `[C]` to access your _magical, pocket sized_ cauldron for brewing

**Made with:**
- Godot 4
- Inkscape, Krita and Gimp
- LibreOffice Draw
