games.name: Deep Dreamers
games.body:
**Deep Dreamers** is a small and kinda cozy action platformer with retro early 16bit-era vibes.
The player is a heroine trying to save a girl from the perpetual sleep, 
fighting nightmares in the deep cave of her mind.


Is my first take into a more action-platform game :)
All the art, music, sound effects etc were made by me

I highly recommend to play it on ITCH.IO for fullscreen size view



Controls -----------------------------------------------

* Move: Arrow Keys
* Jump: Space
* Shoot: D
* Carry/Drop the girl: S
* Drop from a platform: Down + Jump

* Advance text on cutscene: Space

* GAMEPAD is fully supported

To shoot you need to not be holding the girl.

----------------------------------------------------------
Tools:

* Godot 4.4
* Aseprite
* Reaper
* Sourcetree + Github
* Audacity
* ChipTone

Version 1.1:----------------------------------------------

Fixed bugs:
* Body falling after teleport
* CRT filter not displaying on cutscenes
* Stucked out of screen after death
* Brown Nightmare collision shape size
* Girl falling over when drop in a wall
* 4:3 aspect ratio not updated

# Instructions

games.body:
![cover_art.png](///raw/6ee/06/z/6a94e.png)
Your tenth birthday arrives, and you feel the familiar sting of loneliness, a constant companion in the crowded city. All you wished for was connection, someone to understand the quiet hum in your soul. games.name: Coffin' Time
games.body:
![screen 1.png](///raw/ee6/c5/z/69a43.png)
 **Joe the cemetery caretaker needs to DRILL in order to store all the coffins of the newly deceased townfolks.**


Play here : https://nicolanore.itch.io/coffintime


There are three phases / stages in the game:

**Drill phase**

**Coffin'Time**

**Funerals**



# 1. Drill phase

Use your mouse to point the direction where you want the drill to dig.

The fuel that is consumed when the dirt is removed is limited. Plan accordingly!

You can end the drilling phase manually by clicking the button at the top right.

# 2. Coffin'Time

Use the mouse to drag and drop the coffins to bury them. Be careful, you need to finish your job before the end of the night!

You can end the burying phase manually by clicking the button at the top right.

Tip: You can stack the members of the same family together, in order to save some space. 

# 3. Funeral 

The townfolks come early in the morning to mourn their losses. Let‚Äôs hope they don‚Äôt stumble across some coffins layin in the morning sun‚Ä¶

 

*Credits :*

*Nicolas Lanore*

*Linda Hammoud*

*Alexis Louis*

*Th√©o Walcker*

*Boris Escande*

![screnshot.JPG](///raw/ee6/c5/z/69a3e.jpg)

This game was made in godot 4.4 in 48h for the Ludum Game Jam 57.

games.name: Escape From GR0K Tower
games.body:
SUMMARY
-------

This is a simple Tower Escape game where you must avoid traps and find the trigger to open the gate on each floor.

There are 100 floors to escape from and each floor gets harder than the last. There is only ever ONE trigger to open the gate on the floor, there will ALWAYS be multiple traps to slow you down or hurt you.

Good Luck!

Thanks for playing my game!

TRAILER
-------

My youngest sone created a trailer for the game.

https://youtu.be/x4eToNxAvJc?si=a0KK8aYnA8FFLuPX


INSTRUCTIONS
------------
- MOVE LEFT = A or LEFT ARROW
- MOVE RIGHT = D or RIGHT ARROW
- INTERACT = E or DOWN ARROW
- JUMP = SPACE or UP ARROW
- RUN = HOLD SHIFT

X/Grok Factor
-------------

For this game I did a bit of an experiment. To come up with the idea for the game, I used GROK on X to work through the game elements and even had it generate some pseudo code, which I used for initial prototyping. I then continued to work on the game without the help of GROK to completion.

It was an interesting experiment, and I found that it was actually able to come up with several good ideas, but I needed to guide it in order to zero in on what I wanted to make.

PICTURES
--------
![2025-04-07_08-43-48.png](///raw/8f3/1/z/6a230.png)
![2025-04-07_08-44-40.png](///raw/8f3/1/z/6a22d.png)

games.name: Layered
games.body:
My first Game Jam, and my first game--a minimalist puzzle game _very very very_ loosely inspired by the layers within deep neural networks. It's incredibly short, but it was a fun experience!

![Screenshot 2025-04-07 at 20.03.06.png](///raw/e87/36/z/6abfe.png)

## Fun Facts

- The entire game is written in Rust using a 2.5D game engine I'm making myself (https://gitlab.com/caer/layered), building off of work done by Macroquad (https://macroquad.rs).
- Levels are built with pixel art (https://gitlab.com/caer/layered/-/blob/main/assets/layer-5.png), which is parsed at run-time (https://gitlab.com/caer/layered/-/blame/main/src/tile.rs#L378) into a level based on which pixels are colored (and how).
- All the non-sound assets and art are my own, drawing heavily from my personal brand (https://www.caer.cc).
- The music is by MooMarMouse (https://moomarmouse.itch.io/sweet-little-ambiance) on Itch.io.
- The sound effects are by JDWasabi (https://jdwasabi.itch.io/8-bit-16-bit-sound-effects-pack) on Itch.io.

games.name: Ruby Hole
games.body:
### Summary
The gnomes are trying to get rich off the rubies üíé they find, digging tunnels deeper and deeper as long as their conscience and construction tiles hold out. Exploring the depths requires caution‚Äîno one knows what the gnomes might dig up next üêâ

### Story
Deep within the bowels of ancient mountains, two daring gnomes, Borin Stonebiter ‚Äãand Thrommir Ironbeard‚Äã, labor to create a tunnel that will lead them to treasures hidden for millennia. Despite the elders' warnings, these enterprising treasure seekers decided to begin mining the oldest land. Around them is only the echoing sound of picks and the dim light of torches illuminating the gloomy vaults of the mine. The rock here is hard as if the earth itself resists their efforts, but the gnomes do not despair: after all, in the depths awaits a cache of rubies shining brighter than stars. üåü

Borin, an experienced miner with muscular arms and a cunning gaze, keeps count of his pickaxe strikes, each time digging deeper into the stone mass. His partner, Thrommir, a calculating and cautious master blacksmith, occasionally checks the sharpness of the tools' blades to make the work go faster and more efficiently. Together they form the perfect team: one digs, the other supports, both dream of wealth waiting at the end of the path. üí∞

Each blow of the pick brings them closer to their goal. Each ruby found fills their hearts with joy and hope. And although there is still much work ahead, Borin and Thrommir are confident: someday they will reach their coveted prize and become legends among all gnomes, but at what cost? üíÄ

### Contacts
https://x.com/epiclogogames

https://t.me/epiclogogames

https://vk.com/epiclogogames

art https://vk.com/shkaflavasha


### Tutorial
We understand that a wall of text is a bad tutorial, but we didn't want to give up game features in favor of learning (even though we had to due to limited time), so we'll have to read.

![mouse.png](///raw/f76/36/z/6a34b.png)
use left mouse button for place tile on map, and use right mouse button for rotate tile to right side

![tunnel.png](///raw/f76/36/z/69a5b.png)
to build tunnels, you need to connect tiles so that the tunnels on them match

![mush_pla—Åe.png](///raw/f76/36/z/69a5a.png)
to build mushroom caves, you need to connect tiles so that the caves on them match

![mush_not_closed.png](///raw/f76/36/z/69a59.png)
until all the borders of the existing mushroom farm tiles are closed, you will not receive bonuses for building a cave.

![mush_closed.png](///raw/f76/36/z/69a53.png)
to get new tiles for completing the mushroom cave, you need to close all the borders of the tiles already exposed on the field with mushrooms.

![mush_closed_on_border.png](///raw/f76/36/z/69a54.png)
the border can be combined with any title, and the side of the mushroom farm in contact with the border is considered closed.

![ruby.png](///raw/f76/36/z/69a81.png)
A ruby is just a small ruby that turns out to be right in the rock, no bonuses except for the pleasant feeling of the weight of the pocket.

![hole1.png](///raw/f76/36/z/69a82.png)
Ruby Hole is the main reward for any dwarf, the more rubies the more rubies! You need to bring the tunnel to all the ruby holes you can reach.

games.name: You Are the End
games.body:
# "The deeper you go, the more of yourself you lose."

You are a hero‚ÄîHumanity‚Äôs final hope‚Äîsent to descend into a cursed land to destroy the source of corruption.
But every step forward cracks the truth open further: You are not here to save the world. You are here to end it!

## A Descent Into the Depths

- Journey through a doomed, side-scrolling world ‚Äî from the crumbling Castle, past dying Villages, the Battlefield, and to the Throne of the End ‚Äî‚Äã where the land itself decays with each run.
- A great Population Counter ticks down ‚Äî not just a resource, but your health, your army, your soul!
- Will you sacrifice the living for power‚Ä¶ or protect the last breath of humanity?‚Äã

## The Cycle of Death

- ‚ÄãDraw a card ‚Äî Good, Neutral, or Evil. Each offers power, each demands a price.
- Lead your army or descend yourself into the battlefield.
- Fall or triumph ‚Äî either way, the truth deepens.
- New prophecy lines awaken.
- Then it begins again ‚Äî with heavier steps and darker skies.

## Your Prophecy, Written by You

- Five lines. One fate.
- Each step reveals a fragment ‚Äî shaped by your actions, your morality, and your sacrifices.
- Will the world remember you as a saviour? Or curse you as the end?

## Controls ‚Äî Commands of a Dying King

- Arrow Keys ‚Äî Walk the broken path, left and right, through ruin and ash.
- Click to Summon ‚Äî Call forth your warriors... at the cost of your people.
- Cooldowns Apply ‚Äî Each call to arms takes its toll.
- Descend as the King ‚Äî When unlocked, take the field yourself.


## Bugs/Incomplete Features -

- Descend of the King is incomplete. It was supposed to turn the game into a platformer TD from a regular TD where you control the King.
- Some issue with enemy type spawns. There are 4 enemy types, each appearing after successive 25% mark.
- The completion of the prophecy.

## If You Fall‚Ä¶ the Kingdom Falls With You.

games.name: Too Fishy
games.body:
# Too Fishy

A 2.5D underwater exploration game where you dive deeper into the ocean to catch exotic fish and search for your lost friend.

### ! The web version has lag spikes - if you are having issues, you can download the native version.
## About

In Too Fishy, you play as a deep-sea diver exploring the mysterious depths of the ocean. Catch rare fish to sell at the surface, upgrade your submarine, and dive deeper to find your friend who went missing in the darkest depths.

Catch fish, sell them, and upgrade your submarine to explore the ocean's depths. Your friend will introduce you to the world of submarine fishing, but be careful! 
The ocean is full of dangers, and you must be prepared to face them.

We used AI tools to create the games music and two of the models. The rest of the game was made by us.

games.name: DEPTH FIRST
games.body:
You are an AI core trained by a **CRAZY DR**. Your "Master" believes there is a **HELL**. Driven by a depth-first cursed algorithm, guide your robot through procedurally generated labyrinths: place turn stones to avoid lava flows, activate laser guns to blast through walls. When you finally breach Death's domain, how will the underworld bureaucrat judge this human-led suicide mission?

üî•üî•üî•üî•üî•üî•üî•
# PLAY ON WEB!!!
## Itch.io link: https://passbykamenrider.itch.io/depth-first
üî•üî•üî•üî•üî•üî•üî•

# Tutorial:

# Important Things To Know:

# DFS in this game prioritizes in order ‚û°Ô∏è‚¨áÔ∏è‚¨ÖÔ∏è‚¨ÜÔ∏è

## Basic ControlsÔºö

**DFS (Depth-First Search)** is reimagined as the **"Hellscraper Protocol"** in this game, where the robot adheres to a directional hierarchy of Right ‚Üí Down ‚Üí Left ‚Üí Up, with priority order being the key to overcoming hellish challenges.

üèÜ‚û°Ô∏è**Left-Click to Place Turn Stones: **

Place stones on upcoming tiles to forcibly alter robot's moving direction

üì§üñ±Ô∏è**Right-Click + Hold&Drag: **

Move around to see the whole map

üö∂‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏èüß≠**GO Button Starts Pathfinding: **

Robot moves with Right ‚Üí Down ‚Üí Left ‚Üí Up priority after clicking

üîÑüåç**RESET Reinstates the Level: **

Click to remove all stones **(NO LAVA AND BROKEN WALL WILL BE MOVE)**

## Tiles you need to know:

![floor1.PNG](///raw/0c0/46/z/6a90a.png)

Floor, of course, the place you can walk through(hopefully)

AH, LAVA! deadly, very deadly, **VERY VERY DEADLY**

The END, jump down and find it(to find what)

Why does it always appear in the bottom right corner

![ItemKey.png](///raw/0c0/46/z/6a91c.png)

A Laser Gun! what can it do?

![ItemCrackedWall.PNG](///raw/0c0/46/z/6a91e.png)

Aha! A CrackedWall, this is where the laser gun should be used.(**OF COURSE**)

![ItemBox.PNG](///raw/0c0/46/z/6a92b.png)

Turn Stones, It teaches you to turn early

![ThirdRecord.gif](///raw/830/a3/z/6a2f2.gif)

You play as an idol who breaks rocks and collects treasures!

Run and accumulate power to break rocks!

Descend to the deepest and darkest depths and collect all (145) treasures!

## FEATURES

- In-game menu (hub level);
- Keyboard and gamepad support;
- Screen shake;
- Vibration support (only Windows).
- Vibration and screen shake can be turned off at the very beginning of the game (as well as game sounds);
- Fullscreen available at itch.io and Windows.

## CONTROLS

|Controls|	Keyboard|	Gamepad|
|--|--|--|
|Walk|	WASD, Arrows|	Left stick, D-pad|
|Run mode (Hold to run instead of walk)|Shift|Xbox: A, Sony: Cross (X), Nintendo: B|
|Toggle help and stone health (Hold to make it fully visible)| Spacebar| Xbox: LB,RB,LT,RT; Sony: L1,R1,L2,R2; Nintendo: Whatever they are|
|Screenshot to unknown location|Y|Nothing|
P.S. Just kidding! I know screenshots location, it is:
`C:\Users\YourLovelyName\AppData\Roaming\Godot\app_userdata\GOLDLOVING STONEHATING IDOL`

games.name: Luck Runs Out
games.body:
# *Luck Runs Out*

**A game of uncertainty, and the depth of one‚Äôs true feelings**  
_Move with **A & D** or arrow keys_

---

This is the first time I‚Äôve ever finished a game  
And also, my first ever game jam  
And‚Ä¶ maybe, my first time saying things I‚Äôve always locked inside  
  
This isn‚Äôt a game full of mechanics or challenges  
It‚Äôs not flashy, it‚Äôs not clever  
It‚Äôs nothing new  

But it‚Äôs mine,  
a small piece of me,,  

It‚Äôs a mirror, perhaps  
A proof that I did make something  
A reminder of what I could make  

I don‚Äôt know if this game will mean anything to you  
But it means something to me  
And for now, that‚Äôs enough  

---

_Any feedback is deeply appreciated._  
**Thank you for playing.**

*PS. If the web version doesn't work, you can also try the itch.io version:*

games.name: Chthonic Cacophony
games.body:
Dig deep into the dictionary to help these philosophers sustain their dialogue for as long as possible. Connect their thoughts with the conversation and see how profound their rhetoric can get!

This game is playable in your browser, but we highly recommend downloading and playing the Windows build instead for better visuals and performance.

‚Äã**Content Warning!**‚Äã

1. If you are sensitive to motion or flashing lights, please proceed with caution. The movement of the pillars in the background can be overwhelming for some.
2. Our dictionary is taken from a GitHub repository‚Äã, and has not been vetted for appropriateness. Please be aware you may see some words that could be considered inappropriate.

**Controls**

This game is controlled entirely with the mouse. Left-click on the words coming out of a philosopher's head that match with the ones in the dialogue box to progress.

**Credits**

- Game design and core gameplay programming by puregarlic
- Environment art and visual processing by hextraza
- Character art and additional programming by tepichord
- Music and sound design by Holofoil

**Attributions**

- Fonts used are Redacted Script, Kalam, Flow Block, and Yatra One through the Open Font License
- Roman Marble Column model provided by Ergin ERYILDIR on SketchFab through the CC Attribution 4.0 License
Textures used from Material Pack Stone And Bricks -01 provided by Julio Sillet 3D Art through the CC Attribution 4.0 License
- Julius Ceasar bust‚Äã image provided by Following Hadrian on Openverse through the CC BY-SA 2.0 License
- Marble bust of Emperor Antonius Pius image provided by Snapshooter46 on Openverse through the CC BY-NC-SA 2.0 License

Built using Godot Engine, ProCreate Dreams, Inkscape, GIMP, Affinity Photo, Blender, Openverse, and Ableton Live.

games.name: The Deepest Diamond
games.body:
[Itch Page](https://silliest-goose.itch.io/the-deepest-diamond)

You are a cave explorer looking for interesting samples. Run with WASD or Arrows to traverse the twisting paths! Jump and dive with Space to leap dangerous gaps! Grab throw and put down specimen with E to bring them back to the minecart!

Find and retrieve all 6ish samples:

1. Amethyst Geode - Great to start.

2. Gigantic Bone - Too wide for some gaps.

3. Large Glow Worm - Wriggles too tall for some ledges.

4. Blood Opal - Several tons in weight, you can't jump while holding it.

5. Amber Drop - Sticky to the point you move at a snails pace, you can still jump though.

6. The Deepest Diamond - Deep under the lava, you will have to collect this last.

?. The Silliest Goose - ??????.

Bonus challenge: Speed run
Try and beat the Dev's time : 3:23.693
Or the fastest in the comments : Be the first!
This kinda goes on the honor system, also no geese allowed!

Dev note: This actually came out pretty good in my eyes. In previous years I've had to cut down a lot, which still happened, though to a very lesser degree. This was also my first fully 3d project. I ended up learning a lot about how unity works along the way. Anyways hope you enjoy!

PS. Sometimes it seems you can get stuck on the walls, just try and jump above the block to fix it.

Programing & Art:
The Silliest Goose

Music: Night Cave - Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/

Rotate while dragging - RMB

games.body:
Dive into the dark depths of the ocean, where a lonely Blobfish fights for life! His world is full of dangers - predatory fish and treacherous traps lie in wait at every step. But in the distance, a saving light flickers - his only hope!

This is my first full game and first participation in a jam.

I plan to continue developing the game if it is interesting to players, there are many ideas what can be done!

![ad-light-screenshot-1.png](///raw/9e0/46/z/6b024.png)

games.name: The Depths of Magic
games.body:
![The Depths of Magic Title.png](///raw/98d/34/z/6a3fb.png)

# Use the Itch.io link to play in browser
## If it fails to run - make sure you are using Chrome or Microsoft Edge

You are a wizard in search of magical knowledge and power, and have arrived at The Dungeon in search of such things.

The Dungeon's own magic spawns guardians: Bugs, Imps, and Demon Dogs. But, some of that magic lies behind each door for you to claim as your own.

The Dungeon's magic is dark and powerful, and your greed grows as you delve, becoming unable to leave.

How far into the depths will you get before you succumb to the magic you have made your own?

### WASD to move - Click (can hold) to shoot at mouse pointer

![GameplayImage.png](///raw/98d/34/z/6a397.png)

![The Depths of Magic Pick Power.png](///raw/98d/34/z/6a3ad.png)

No AI was used in the making of this project.
- Engine: Godot 4.4.1
- Programming: Hungry and MrDandro
- Art: benjamm
- Song: bgm action 1 by CodeManu - 8-bit Music Pack

games.name: Forge Rush
games.body:
![6a16d.png.320x256.fit.jpg](///raw/cfe/a5/z/6a5bd.jpg)
## About 
You are a team of dwarfs setting up a forge near the newly discovered underground ruins. Craft and supply explorers with various equipment or else your forge will be overrun with monsters from the depths!

## How to play

Use various crafting stations around the map to craft items that are requested by the explorers, deliver those items to appropriate counter to finish the order. Complete as many orders as you can to upgrade your forge or compete for highscore! Fail to deliver enough orders in time and you will lose!

The Game is either Singleplayer or local Co-op. Get more hands for easier game, we didn't implement player count difficulty scaling!

## Controls

| Action       | Keyboard      | Controller     |
|--------------|---------------|----------------|
| Menu/Pause   | Escape        | Menu Button    |
| Moving       | WASD          | Left Joystick  |
| Dash         | Space         | X              |
| Interact     | F             | A              |
| Take/Drop    | E             | B              |
| Join Game    | J             | Y              |
| Show Recipes | Tab           | Right Shoulder |

## Gameplay

Different stations have different recipes available to them. You need to figure out which station can produce which recipe.

You can use nearby tables as storage places if you run out of time for an order and don't want to destroy a particular piece of equipment.

You can also use a garbage bin to dispose of any item in case there's too much stuff lying around.

There are two stations:

* Crafting bench
* Anvil

## Screenshots

games.name: Flatline
games.body:
Cling to life and find the strength to survive in this puzzle arcade.

# HOW TO PLAY

Game supports Keyboard, Gamepad & Mobile controls

+ WASD, DPad, Swipe - Move yourself once in a specific direction spending a charge

+ Blue Blocks - Gives charge, but becomes Red on hit

+ Yellow Blocks - Doesn't Recharge and gets destroyed on hit

+ Red Blocks - Flatlines You

+ Leaving Boundaries - Warps you to the opposite side of the screen

+ White Star - Reaching it completes the level

# ‚ÄãCREDITS

* Mikhail " XpMonster " Prokhorov‚Äã - Director, Game Design, Level Design, Programming & Art

* Alexander " Rainesphere " Raines‚Äã - Original Soundtrack & Sound Design

* Jerem Watts‚Äã - Male Voice Over

* OGma_badparenting101‚Äã - Female Voice Over‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã

games.name: Granny's Gotcha
games.body:
![Bildschirmfoto 2025-04-08 um 03.02.04.png](///raw/f90/21/z/6b01e.png)

![Bildschirmfoto 2025-04-08 um 03.02.32.png](///raw/f90/21/z/6b01f.png)

What helps with problems? - Granny knows the answer!
Whether it's a lost contact lens, a runny nose or time pressure to catch the next bus - Granny knows what you need: sweets!
And oh boy, she has lots of them in her dusty old handbag. Whether you like it or not, Granny will provide you with the most delicious treasures she has collected over the last 88 years.


Everyone deserves sweets!
Pay attention to the children's requests. They have precise ideas about what sweets they would like from Granny:
Round, flower-shaped, triangular, oblong, salty, Christmasy, Halloweeny, lollies, chocolate and cookies.
Many of them are even available in different colors: Red, yellow & green.

games.name: Deep Hour
games.body:
![LudumDareThumbnail.png](///raw/165/b3/z/6aea4.png)

Play WebGL on itch.io below!

In Deep Hour you play as an overworked salaryman trapped in the haunted depths of his office building long after everyone else has gone home. Inspired by the eerie liminality of the backrooms, the building stretches into surreal, endless corridors filled with ghostly remnants of corporate burnout.
Armed with only a flickering flashlight, you must venture deeper room by room, using light to capture restless spirits. Face your fears, and descend into the depths of your own exhaustion... if you dare clock out.

Made in 3 Days for Ludum Dare 57. Theme: Depths

Art:  
[Lucas Moreira](https://www.linkedin.com/in/moreiralucash/)

games.body:
![ld_banner.png](///raw/38d/36/z/6acf1.png)

Travel through mountains, navigating heights and depths. Visit all locations within a limited time and points. Choose your path and aim to finish faster with fewer points. You need to visit all locations before 00:00.

![32333345.png](///raw/38d/36/z/6b2e8.png)

How to Play:

-LMB to place a point.

-LMB on a point to remove it.

-RMB to navigate.

-Press "Start" to begin moving.

-Press "Clear" to remove all points.

-Press "Restart" to start over.

-Press "Help" for assistance.

-Press "Hide UI" to hide the interface.

Engine: Unity

All sounds from Freesound.org

games.name: Wishing Well
games.body:
Play as a coin making its way to the bottom of the well! 

Will your wish come true???

 ¬†
Controls

Left/Right - arrow keys or A and D

Spin - Spacebar (for fun only... for now!)


Dev Notes:

Originally made for the compo, I lost Sunday due to some irl things. A very simple game where the primary focus for me was to learn some art finally! The biggest win for me was that all art was made by me from scratch inside 48 hours. I had a lot of fun.

TRUE STORY: I have never done pixel (or any art) for games before, and I only downloaded Libresprite 15 minutes before the jam started. I was very happy with my progress from 0 to .. well not 0 lol baby steps! 


#### FULLSCREEN GAMEPLAY AVAILABLE VIA ITCH.IO LINK BELOW ###

games.name: Deep Sea Torpedo
games.body:
# **üî± Deep Sea Torpedo**


## **üéÆ Controls**

| Action          | Key  |
|---------------|------|
| Move Forward  | `W`  |
| Move Backward | `S`  |
| Turn Left     | `A`  |
| Turn Right    | `D`  |
| Move Up       | `Shift` |
| Move Down     | `Ctrl` |
| Fire Torpedo  | `Space` |
| Aim  |`Mouse` |

## **üéØ Objective**

- Navigate through **all underwater areas** without being destroyed.

- Avoid **enemy submarines**, **dangerous sea creatures**, and **hazardous currents**.

- Use **stealth and torpedoes** to survive.


## **üåä Features**

‚úÖ **Realistic Underwater Physics** ‚Äì Experience deep-sea movement with currents and buoyancy.

‚úÖ **Hostile Enemies** ‚Äì Enemy submarines **hunt you down** and fire torpedoes.

‚úÖ **Dynamic Environment** ‚Äì Underwater **currents shift** over time, affecting movement.

‚úÖ **Exploration & Survival** ‚Äì Carefully navigate each area **before the next one spawns**.


## **üí• Dangers & Challenges**

- **üî¥ Enemy Submarines** ‚Äì Detect and fire at you when in range.

- **üåä Underwater Currents** ‚Äì Push your submarine, **forcing constant readjustments**.

- **üí£ Limited Health** ‚Äì Taking too much damage means **game over!**


## **üèÜ Winning & Losing**

‚úîÔ∏è **Win**: Successfully navigate through all areas.

‚ùå **Lose**: If your submarine's health reaches **0**.

games.name: Depth Survivor
games.body:
This is a fast-paced depth crawler where players fight through 10 increasingly challenging levels. After each wave of enemies, players choose from a set of upgrades to shape their build before diving deeper. The final stage features a tough boss encounter to cap off the run.

I focused heavily on building modular systems, a level editor, and developing enemy AI, which took more time than expected‚Äîso the level structure isn‚Äôt as polished or scalable as I'd like. Still, I hope you enjoy the core loop and the challenge!

Controls : WASD - Movement

games.name: Getting Drilled!
games.body:
![Screenshot 2025-04-07 214751.png](///raw/6ac/32/z/6a1b0.png)

![Screenshot 2025-04-07 215045.png](///raw/6ac/32/z/6a1b1.png)

Getting Drilled! is a twist on the classic game Breakout. Smash your way downward through the layers of ground using your high-powered drill. Just like in breakout, getting in amongst the tiles will cause some point scoring chaos. Descend into the depths collecting gems and rare minerals which will give you a large points boost. Watch out for the lava and get as deep as you can in 3 mins.

games.name: Dig in, Gus!
games.body:
Meet Gus, a down-on-his-luck mole and the recent beneficiary of his father's will. Gus inherited his father's massive debt, along with his prized pair of drill gloves. Left with no other option, he descends into the depths of the earth to mine for ore and get rich fast in the hopes of paying off his debt.

## Controls:
 ```
on keyboard
WASD to move
LMB to dig
RMB to fire grapling hook
SPACE to jump.

on a controller

Left Analog or DPAD to move
RB to dig
RT to fire grapling hook
A (XBOX) B(Switch) X (PS) to jump
```

games.name: Archeologic
games.body:
If archeology was a bit like tetris combined with a match 3 game, it would look like this game.

**Controls**

- WASD to move, hold Left Mouse to grab blocks, Q and E to rotate the camera

or 

- Arrows to move, hold Z to grab blocks, X and C to rotate the camera.

Move around while holding a block to drag it around.

![basics1.gif](///raw/564/1/z/6b31f.gif)

Put 3 boxes of the same type together to make them disappear.

![block_action.gif](///raw/564/1/z/6b32a.gif)

Pick up the bomb to light the fuse.

**The Objective**

Dig down to reach the bottom of this mysterious catacomb and claim your prize. Bombs are your friends in this one.

**Known bugs**

- The exit at the bottom might be flipped around. If all else fails, look for a shiny particle.
- WebGL build has some frame hiccups in the first seconds of the game, but it should be pretty smooth afterwards!

games.name: Antz vs Plantz
games.body:
![tiny logo.png](///raw/052/d2/z/6b329.png)

![Gif.gif](///raw/052/d2/z/6b2a7.gif)

### Description
Tower Defense meets Pachinko! Defeat a variety of different Antz with the power of your Plantz! There are 10 different Plantz to choose from and lots of strategic placements! If you're a fan of Plants vs Zombies, you'll love this!

### Useful Tips!
- Mouse to interact with game elements
- You can place Plantz on top of other plants to overwrite them!
- You can click on ants to damage them a little...
- 1-10 on keyboard for Plantz shortcuts
- You can click on coins to pick them up!
- Clicking on the tree characters has a little audio treat!

### Team
Programming & SFX : [Viktor](https://bluepinstudio.com/)

Artist: [Keely](https://store.steampowered.com/app/2267230/Chicken_Scratch/)

Audio: [Manisha](https://www.youtube.com/@WannibeManisha)


If you have performance issues on web, download the standalone builds below!

games.name: Infernal Bites: Food delivery in the depths of hell
games.body:
‚ÄãThis is Infernal Bites: Food delivery in the depths of hell, Our LD57 JAM submission for the theme "Depths". The game was made in  one weekend.



‚Äã‚Äã![infernalbites_menu.png](///raw/e07/d1/z/6a7e7.png)

*‚ÄãYou are running a food delivery service in the Depths of Hell*


- Use W/S/A/D for movement 

- Use SPACE to jump.

- Look around with the mouse. 

- ‚ÄãDrive to the InfernalBites store to pickup food for delivery

- Figure out where to deliver, using the GPS/Compass. 

- The house where you need to deliver the food has lit windows and a red lit sign next to the door.

- After delivering the food, return to the shop for another pickup. 


Play the game on our itch.io page: https://datadelft.itch.io/infernalbites

games.name: Dwarvenshaft
games.body:
## HOW TO PLAY:

Click on Dwarves to select them, then click on blocks for them to mine, or have them mine automatically. Once you have enough resources, buy things on the market, such as new Dwarves, to progress faster. Once you get a Drill, you can dig straight down to the next layer, but you will waste the Drill to do so.


## CONTROLS:

* Left Mouse Button: Interact
* Right Mouse Button: Deselect
* Escape: Back to Main Menu


## CREDITS:

* ART, CODE, MUSIC: Mateus Boga
* SFX: Mateus Boga; Footsteps by Jedimichael on Freesound.org; Pickaxe Sounds by WolfOWI, FALCONS_SHADOW and EminYILDIRIMon Freesound.org

## LINK: https://mateusboga.itch.io/dwarvenshaft

**(NOTES: The LD site version of this game does not support saves, go to the Itch version to be able to autosave.)**

games.name: The Retreat
games.body:
![The Retreat](///raw/00e/84/z/6a464.png)

***Will you find peace in this cosy hideaway in the depths of the woods?  
Or will you find something else?***

Life is cold and relentless, but this cabin is perfect.  
You. The woods. Just an escape from it all.  
Shame the previous occupant left it in a bit of a state - what were they trying to hide?  
I'm sure you can work it out, if you look hard enough.

games.name: into the forest depths
games.body:
![image (4).png](///raw/444/36/z/6a6ae.png)
You are a postman, but important addressees live in the wilderness, get to them and deliver all the parcels, but be careful, the deeper the forest, the more dangerous it is!
   
 ‚ÄãCombat Tutorial. How to fight?
![1.png](///raw/244/46/z/6ad3d.png)
    1. "Attack" 

First select body part to hit, then press "Attack" button.
Exactly in this order!‚Äã‚Äã

‚Äã‚Äã‚ÄãEach body part has stats: Armor - reduces incoming damage. Miss chance - probability to miss.  
‚ÄãHitting same body part repeatedly can sever it: severed legs = easier to hit, severed arms = enemy can barely attack. ‚Äã
‚Äã‚Äã
    
    2. "Try to escape"

Success = enemy disappears forever. Failure = skip turn and take damage

![4.png](///raw/244/46/z/6ae1f.png)
![3.png](///raw/244/46/z/6ae25.png)

This is a small turn-based semi-RPG game created for Ludum Dare 57. Move across the map, meet strange characters, kill ghouls and deliver packages deeper and deeper into the forest. Thanks for playing and enjoy your journey into the darkness!

games.name: Unearth
games.body:
![Cover photo (2).png](///raw/2fb/04/z/698c6.png)



*Lava suddenly rising from the depths of the planet not only awakens the Duggots, but threatens their very existence.  No way but upwards.*

# [‚û§ Play now](https://milestonegames.itch.io/unearth)



![queen.png](///raw/2fb/04/z/6a4b9.png)

## **Description:**

Newly awakened to the heat of the rising lava, the Queen of the Duggots is faced with no other choice but to rise from the depths to escape the threat from below.

Having never before ascended, the Duggots are facing quite the challenge. What secrets are buried in the massive earth above? And how do you dig yourself up without getting trapped below the dirt? 

Help the queen to organise her minions and find their way to the surface!

---

## **How to play:**

**Move mouse to look around**
Or use W, A, S, D keys

**Scroll to zoom in or out**
Or use + and - keys

**Click to select worker**
- Click and drag to select multiple workers
- Press the Space key to deselect all workers

**Right-click to tell worker where to go**
- Click and drag to mark an area for mining
- Click while holding Control to cancel mining

### **Now go dig yourself to the surface!**

![Digger.gif](///raw/2fb/04/z/698c7.gif)
![Screenshot 2025-04-08 025733.png](///raw/09f/82/z/6ae97.png)


---

**Game Development:**

This game was developed by six members of the Dubious Potions indie collective.

All of the aspects of the game where developed within 72 hours of Ludum Dare 57, from idea to final build.

All assets in the game where made by the team.

We had an amazingly fun time doing this! <3

![DigDubPot.gif](///raw/f9d/04/z/62730.gif)

games.name: Fall Off
games.body:
![Cover.png](///raw/9fd/36/z/6b247.png)

https://hb10001.itch.io/fall-off

Game made in ~48h for Ludum Dare 55.

Theme: Depth
Solo dev entry for Jam.

- - - - - - -

üéÆ Controls

    ¬∑Move: WASD or Arrow Keys

    ¬∑Dash (side): Double-tap ‚Üê or ‚Üí

    ¬∑Power Dash (down strike): K or X (Unlocks after Level 2)

    ¬∑Slow Time: Hold Shift (Unlocks after Level 3)

    ¬∑Shoot (downward bullets): Hold J or Z (Unlocks after Level 4)

    ¬∑Start Game: Press any key

- - - - - - -

üíØ How Scoring Works

    ¬∑You gain points continuously while falling ‚Äî the faster you fall, the faster you score!

    ¬∑Defeating enemies grants extra points

    ¬∑Grazing bullets while dashing gives bonus points

- - - - - - -

This was my first time participating in Ludum Dare, and I had a lot of fun!  
I admit the game is far from finished, but it gave me tons of inspiration and reignited my passion as a game developer ‚Äî and I couldn't be happier.

Did I work all night? Sure I did!  
It reminded me just how much joy making a game can bring ‚Äî after years of crunching.

Maybe I'll keep working on it and publish it as an indie game one day.

games.name: Murder for Dessert
games.body:
You're **Brennan**, a detective hired to investigate the murder of Phillip Bezerra in the fanciest restaurant around: *The Grand Apricot*. Talk to the suspects, keep their lines in mind, and point out important inconsistencies and relationships between their accounts. It's up to you to get to the bottom of this case, so dig deep, expose the culprit and bring them to Justice!

## Instructions
Entering *The Grand Apricot*, you'll be presented with the numerous colourful suspects. Click on any one of them to initiate a conversation.

When you do, you'll see a panel on the right-hand side of your screen showing your progress extracting information from them. Click any button with a dialogue bubble to start talking.

During conversations, you'll see a little pin next to the suspect's dialogue box, if you think that line might be important, **put a pin on it** by clicking the Pin icon. This will put that line in your Inventory and from there you can read it, or use it during any other conversation to help you uncover the truth.

If you can no longer get any information, you'll be **BRICK WALLED**, and the buttons will reflect that, move on to someone else, or see if you missed anything!

## Credits

Fupicat: Graphics, music, sound design, story wrangling, dialogue writing.

Kett: Programming, dialogue writing.

[Full list of credits and assets here!](https://github.com/KettLovahr/murder-for-dessert?tab=readme-ov-file#credits)

games.name: Slipping Away
games.body:
Somewhere underground. A cat loses its yarn ball‚Äîand begins to fall up.

Claws out, tail twitching, it dives deeper into the earth, away from the heavens above. The world is flipped, gravity reversed, but the mission stays the same: find the yarn while avoiding scary cucumbers.

Strange caverns echo with memories. Floating debris, gleaming spikes, and lurking shadows pull the cat further from the light. Each leap is a choice. Each misstep, a new fate.

Will the cat find what it‚Äôs chasing?
Or is it just running from what‚Äôs above?

games.name: It's madness, my dudes
games.body:
Yo dude, grab a snorkel or at least a bucket cause we got urgent frog business!
We‚Äôre scared. It‚Äôs dark. But we gotta go deep. Like, real deep. The frog world‚Äôs in danger and only you can save it. No pressure or anything.

![LD57_game_jam_Depths.png](///raw/5a3/46/z/6ae40.png)

The Great Kwan had a dream. Said there‚Äôs some ultra-powerful artifact chillin way down at the bottom of the ocean under like a million tons of wet doom.
So yeah, you‚Äôre gonna have to smash blocks, unlock ancient frog doors, and fight off the deep froggin‚Äô madness. Ribbit happens, bro.

Three totally cracked frogs are already squished inside the bathyscaphe, arguing over snacks and controls. And you? You‚Äôre comin too.
There‚Äôs puzzles, weird noises, and a madness that‚Äôll have you hearin frog voices whisper "ribbit" while you brush your teeth.

![bandicam 2025-04-08 03-17-27-069.gif](///raw/cf6/b2/z/6b153.gif)

Dude, if you don‚Äôt dive ‚Äî who will?
Jump in, grab the hook, and go find that thing before frogkind croaks for good.
It‚Äôs deep. It‚Äôs dumb. It‚Äôs destiny.

![bandicam 2025-04-08 03-11-07-439 (1).gif](///raw/cf6/b2/z/6afaa.gif)

For the best experience, we suggest playing the Windows version.
